Content: Excellent culinary experience!! A real treat with unexpected flavors and mixtures but extremely good. I love the product side of the garden. The cooks were really going to pick up their vegetables in the garden behind us. Thank you also for visiting the kitchens and the attention of the chef  I'd rather come back as a family next time.

Author: Patrick V
Content: A sublimation of the plant in a clean and conducive to tasting... A very good welcome and a philosophy that is magnified in the dishes....an efficient and friendly service and perfectly adapted wines.... A great moment of gastronomy....congratulations to the whole team

Author: Coralie G
Content: Fine and upscale cuisine with local products. The dishes are served in good proportions, which becomes rare in starred restaurants.  You can go with your eyes closed. The setting, the welcome, the visit to the kitchen with our 2 children during dinner, everything was perfect. Can't wait to get back! Bravo, Chief.

Author: Chalets de ludr... a
Content: We have not adhered to Mr Aribert's vision of cooking. It would be desirable to heat the restaurant room a little: we kept jacket or sweater for dinner. The service personnel do not seem to me to be at the level of a 2* Michelin

Author: panta9
Content: Wedding anniversary meal great discovery to redo a young and dynamic team attentive with professionalism well done  Annick and Leo

Author: Pascal9138
Content: We took the 13-course menu including one without salt for Madame (Thanks to the chef) to celebrate the birthdays of my two children. We had an unforgettable evening. Everything was perfect, the service, the dishes with new flavors as well as the adaptation to change a dish. We also liked the presentation and preparation of the cheese plate and the champagne. A first for my children in a Michelin-starred restaurant that they won't soon forget.

Author: ETIENNE F
Content: Incredible discovery. Impeccable service, a place where you immediately feel good with an ultra attentive team. The dishes are fantastic with a parade of very surprising flavors and a juxtaposition of delicious dishes. The cooking experience at the chef's table is quite exceptional. A creative adventure that we seek when we create large tables (but not always successfully). Probably one of the best starred restaurants we have had the chance to try.

Author: Roland M
Content: Beautiful house, refined decor, what a beautiful evening, what a great discovery, we loved it from the beginning to the end of the meal, flavors, excellent cuisine, perfect service, well done.

Author: GROSSO D
Content: Magnificent refined meal and with a lot of research work We feel the cook's love for good products

Author: Billy d
Content: Beautiful room. Friendly, discreet and efficient staff. The dishes I ate were excellent: broccoli hummus + Romans ravioli in its broth + reworked brioche. For 37 euros, it's great. A stone's throw from the Grand H√¥tel d'Uriage. What more ??

Author: tbaro
Content: We reserved the table in the kitchen, which C. Aribert calls "the office", and we had an extraordinary time. Dining at this table allows you to see how the chef works with his team, like an orchestra conductor in fact, who sets the tempo and takes care of all the details. It is also the unique possibility of having the chef who comes to meet you several times to serve you a dish and explain the secrets of its genesis and its creation: an absolutely exceptional experience! Obviously the meal was sublime, the plates were beautifully prepared, the blend of flavors a permanent discovery, the cooking of the fish a treat.

Author: Brigitte D
Content: Excellent welcome, sublime dinner full of flavors and originality. Nice room, delicious breakfast. We had such a good time that we also had lunch at the √Ä caf√©. It's difficult to leave such a beautiful, friendly place. We will come back

Author: Debs
Content: Extraordinary table of varieties of flavors and aroma. Modern cuisine using local resources. Simple, discreet but warm atmosphere thanks to top-notch young staff.

Author: 74yr
Content: Excellent time in a relaxing environment. A smiling and attentive team without adding too much! The gratin dauphinois is delicious! Lake Geneva perch with char eggs! and the goat cheese show! Thanks to the chef and his brigade! The room was great! My wife took the cooking class the next day and was delighted.

Author: FamilleF94
Content: What a magnificent stage! We returned for the second time to Maison Aribert and this time again, we were blown away. The concept of the hotel is truly relaxing, in a zen and refined atmosphere. The food is excellent, the flavors subtle, all in a magnificent setting, accompanied by a very high level of service. Well done Chef to you and your team! We will come back.

Author: yoyo 24
Content: This house is simply exceptional  I rediscovered tastes from my childhood and new flavors. We took the 10 course menu for a journey of quality and unique flavors. A bread accompanied by a rosemary butter without words. Congratulations to the chef and all these employees for this unforgettable moment. Absolutely worth discovering.

Author: Gis√®le g
Content: I was ashamed. We invited a couple friends for lunch in this 2 Michelin star. Sorry, my friends, we didn't know that we were going to share a small tartlet (the size of a small bowl, 6 cm in diameter) into 4 for our dessert. What can we say about the piece of pigeon, the only meat dish, the size of a lady's thumb, a lady not in good health, 2 small, very small bites. 2 Michelin stars!!! maybe these were just samples? Will we go back to check it out? useless, the cheese platter only contained goat cheese, only! I don't like goat. Great French cuisine, an insight for foreign tourists, no that's not it, I assure you. There are places where the customer is not taken for a....

Author: 77marena
Content: The cuisine nothing to say excellent But the hellish wait we arrived at 12:30 p.m. the first dish was served to us. 1:45 p.m. the 2nd at 2:30 p.m. Ar√®s having asked for it!!!! We had been at the restaurant for 2 hours No dessert due to lack of time What a shame it spoiled our meal a bit.

Author: marcel
Content: Very nice discovery, refined, tasty meal, taste and originality. Original flavors, surprises while combining local products with great inventiveness. We manage to make us like products that we don‚Äôt necessarily like, which proves that it‚Äôs a very good table ‚ò∫Ô∏è Very nice address

Author: Olivier H
Content: Family dinner for 3 on Saturday July 29, 2023. Very good room service. Chef ARIBERT passes with distinction to greet each table at the end of service to chat for a few minutes. Cuisine anchored in the local and very plant-based sometimes too much... excellent freshwater fish. The pigeon offered as meat is too segmented. We didn't take it.

Author: MB1313
Content: It was magical. What a world-class menu with a regional touch that Heinrich Schneider and team celebrated in this truly magical location. In addition, perfect beverage selection from Gisela Schneider and a really formidable service. A wonderful evening of enjoyment that we will certainly not forget. And then the perfect sunrise after a comfortable night's sleep in a mega-loft room. Many thanks to everyone for this fantastic feel-good experience.

Author: F L
Content: A hidden gem in then mountain area where you can thoroughly enjoy the tranquility. We loved our room of chic design and with a terrace overlooking a piece of grassland.  Room is spotless cleaned.  Comfy bedding and good shower.  We had a dinner in the Michelin restaurant which one shouldn't miss.  Seamless check-in with a sparking wine (in fact any drinks you like) as a welcome drink.  The management is very attentive and caring.  It was my birthday the night we stayed in Terra.  I received a piece of birthday cake next day at breakfast time.  What a surprise (as I didn't mention anything when making reservation)!  Thank you Terra for making my stay an unforgettable one!

Author: Werner P
Content: Magic is the key word in all areas of this wonderful hotel.  Friendly welcome, courteous service from all staff, modern and elegant furnishings AND world-class gastronomy and cuisine. The hosts Schneider are highly competent and friendly and live with passion regional connection with international top hospitality. You always want to come back.

Author: Bike
Content: This beautiful property is small and fairly remote. It is fairly new and modern but very much with a mountain theme. The dinners are amazing (Michelin 2*) whether you have the Terra Experience or the regular menu. The staff is extremely welcoming and helpful. The spa is small but very quiet and comfortable. Good hiking trails are nearby, with several rifugios. The views are great from the restaurant and the large decks off the rooms.

Author: Nicolas V
Content: Unbelievable food (well worth its 2 michelin stars), stunning location, beautiful rooms, we loved it!!

Author: Lbr79
Content: Imagine being close to heaven: Sarentino , 1700 meters more or less, the journey to get there is already worth the experience. Reached through a series of hairpin bends you arrive at ‚ÄòTerra‚Äô not surprisingly called ‚ÄúThe magic place‚Äù.... Wonderful location , Relais Chateau with completely eco-sustainable rooms and spa and a restaurant that makes the search for the products of the surrounding environment its workhorse. And we want to talk about his kitchen: 2 Michelin stars and recently deserved green star. Exciting tasting itinerary: a ‚Äòland experience‚Äô that remains etched in the memories of the diner.... The whole gastronomic journey is staggering for research, respect, knowledge, hazards, play.... And Some courses deserve a special mention: mushroom taco, ravioli, veal and wild strawberry dessert symbol of a growing proposal! Earth has everything it takes to be called EXCELLENCE! Here you make peace with yourself and feel pampered! Thank you.

Author: Kim T
Content: Fantastic food (dinner & breakfast) amazing wine at affordable price! Staff is very lovely you feel very welcome. Nice rooms, blinded curtains would have been nice though. Amazing spa!

Author: davideferie
Content: If you have never experienced excellence in catering, this is the place. It is not a simple dinner, it is a real culinary experience, a guided ups and downs of flavors with the experience of the chef and the room managers who know how to guide you on this journey in an excellent way.

Author: Mottolino
Content: everything perfect, a place away from everything where you can live a real experience. I definitely recommend it

Author: Patrizia R
Content: I returned to Terra for the second time, with the fear, as often happens, that something could disappoint me and break the beauty of the memory. However it didn't happen, Terra remains a magical place as the name suggests, where everything lives up to expectations. The welcome was wonderful, warm and informal, the cuisine was sublime and the combinations were perfect, the waiters were fantastic. I don't know what else to say other than we'll be back. PS look at the nice offers on the site, sometimes dreams are more attainable than you think. ...

Author: bessiehung08
Content: It was indeed a memorable, once in a life time experience. It‚Äôs simply amazing, all the details that the staff has put in, their attentiveness,  made our stay even more memorable. Shout out to the restaurant staff Antonio, he was super attentive and very knowledgeable with every ingredient in each dish. Thanks Terra for such an amazing stay!! Love the spa facilities!!!

Author: Rossana98
Content: AMAZING experience! Wonderful dinner in every course and combination, each dish was perfectly balanced, an explosion of flavors and textures, absolutely wonderful. In addition to this, the location is beautiful, you are surrounded by a wonderful landscape, everything is taken care of down to the smallest detail, the welcome is very attentive and kind. To try!!!

Author: Fili Gau√ü
Content: The Terra lives up to its name! A magical place where you can indulge in culinary delights of the highest standard. The exceptionally friendly service, the great location and the wellness area are also worth mentioning.

Author: Avner V
Content: The Terra - The Magic Place, is indeed magical. If you are looking for the perfect escape/indulgence, this is the place. First, you drive on a small road that climbs through the amazing alpine landscape; when you reach to Terra, you are at the top of the mountain. The place only contains a small number of rooms, which means you have all the privacy you want to look out at the outstanding mountain view of the Dolomites and stars at night. Then, of course, is dinner in the two stars Michelin restaurant ‚Äì for three hours you will have one of the most unforgettable meals. The local wine selections that accompany the dishes are incredible. The next morning you must take the 3 hour hike to Omini di pietra ‚Äì the Stone Men site ‚Äì another magical place with stones likely from medieval period that provides a 360 degree panorama of the Dolomitic mountain peaks in South Tyrol.  The combination of the secluded location, the restaurant, the wine, and the breathtaking panorama view of the Dolomites is memorable. We look forward to coming back!

Author: Diana B
Content: Every aspect of out stay was outstanding:  warm welcome, luxurious mountain-view suite with a comfortable bed, a unique and delicious local tasting menu that exceeded all expectations (conception to execution), incredible breakfast, and top hiking trails that leave right from the inn. Deserves three Michelin stars!

Author: oberhofermartina
Content: A wonderful quiet place to relax but above all to pamper your palate - we will come again

Author: Christian0709
Content: I have rarely experienced work with so much heart and passion. Be it the outstanding service, the phenomenal food or the overwhelming landscape/location. A place to feel good, enjoy and unwind. Many thanks to Gisela and Heinrich, as well as the entire team for the great experience!

Author: acg88837
Content: The entire stay was pure perfection. The Schneiders and all the rest of the staff love their job and you can feel that in every detail of the hotel. We will definitely come back.

Author: Giovanni1065
Content: A dream that we have realized... a magical place that can be reached by climbing from Sarentino to the end of the road. The excitement begins when you get out of the car. Kindness and friendliness above all. The structure is very beautiful with a dozen rooms, ours with a large window overlooking the forest, still covered in snow. Absolutely nothing is missing.... The wellness area is small but beautiful and welcoming, adequate for the number of guests. But let's get to the top... dinner. A long and delicious tasting menu, where every single dish deserved the attention of multiple senses... from sight... to aromas... to taste. All accompanied by an excellent wine tasting proposed by Mrs. Gisela. Our first experience in a ** star hotel and we were able to understand and appreciate the research, the study, the work that brings incredible dishes to the table! Much attention also for my celiac wife. The gourmet breakfast is also excellent with dishes and ingredients of the highest quality. A big thank you also to all the staff, very professional and kind who made us feel truly pampered. How can you not return to such a magical place? Until we meet again......

Author: Don Martini
Content: Anyone who loves the natural and the special, the small, the personal, the beautiful, the stylish and the excellent is in the best hands here. A gem in the mountains. The house, the hosts, the food, everything comes together in harmony to create a total experience for all the senses.

Author: ceisner2024
Content: The Terra is a hideaway in the middle of the forest at 1600 meters. It is the perfect place to come down and relax while enjoying exceptional food and TOP wines at fair prices. Charming and skilful, everyone here does their job with passion, especially the hosts

Author: michaeleberz
Content: It was just as fantastic as the first visit! Nowhere else have we eaten and been pampered so first-class. If anything has changed in the past few years, it has only been for the better!

Author: Sabri
Content: Wonderful structure nestled in the mountains. From the welcome to the services offered, everything is taken care of to make you feel at home but at the same time pampered and spoiled. The rooms are new, elegant, clean and with that touch of personality that makes the atmosphere warm and never aseptic. You can also use the spa area which is truly a gem. The hydromassage tub overlooking a wonderful landscape makes everything more magical, the saunas and relaxation area really gave me an afternoon of comfort away from the commitments and stress of the week. The welcome and care that the hosts put into managing and taking care of the guests' stay is impeccable and truly rare. Not just a stay but a real cuddle

Author: rita829
Content: The road to reach it doesn't inspire you and you wonder if it's really the gift you wanted to celebrate your birthday. Then you get to the top and are greeted by ¬†smiling, friendly people. A structure immersed in the woods. Everything inside is clean and new, recently renovated and still smells of wood The room is large with large windows overlooking the woods and you are immediately pervaded by a feeling of calm and serenity. The wellness center is a gem and the hydromassage tub is its centerpiece: you can enjoy a spectacular view of the Dolomites while you are immersed in the warmth of the water illuminated by chromatic lamps. Everything is truly taken care of down to the smallest detail - Gisela and Heinrich Schneider, the owners, are people dedicated to their business and you can see and feel that they put their soul into it. They take care of everything personally: she ranges from reception to restaurant service and is an expert sommelier, her brother is an excellent, very creative chef who creates delicious starred dishes. Nice to know that they have lived in this enchanting place since their childhood and that with the relais they wanted to make their mother's dream come true  What else to add? An unforgettable experience

Author: ANDREA A
Content: A truly magical place as it defines itself, away from everything, ideal for a romantic and gourmet getaway. Incredible dinner with a truly surprising menu from all points of view. Structure with very nice and intimate SPA.. the swimming pool is missing but you don't miss it too much. Super recommended!

Author: PGF94131
Content: We could only secure a table for lunch and the last one at that, several months in advance... Setting: top of a hill, bay windows with views of wild grasses flowing in the wind and trees in the distance. Large dining area, airy, light and comfortable.  We all had the degustation menu and the execution was outstanding in all respects: exquisite presentation, perfect execution. Excellent service. We had a total of 6 courses with many "amuse bouches" in between; We never waited more than a few minutes before being presented with a dish or some preparation meant to intrigue us.   We were a mixed French/American family and party of five and the staff was at ease conversing with everyone in their preferred language, I would venture that such an experience should be lived once (at least). We would definitely return if we could plan our visit far enough in advance.

Author: Jeffrey R
Content: When any French Michelin 3 star restaurant chef/owner tells me that he appreciates my comments about a fairly priced wine list and not gouging his customers with only a list of expensive bottles, as so many of his peers do,  I know I am going to love his place. And we did. What a meal. Reserving for the few spots six months in advance so worth it. From the glorious surroundings of the dining room itself to the exquisite menu and all the extra little dishes that show up along the way. Mushroom foods and things everywhere. Everything is so creative and delicious. Each course a delight. The service so superb‚Äîeven beyond expectations. The wines we chose by the glass and bottle so reasonably priced. One of the major complaints I have had over the years in France is dining at these 2 and 3 and stars and leaving feeling abused by the wine prices. Regis and Jacques disagree with their expansive and fair list list but many under 100 euros for the bottle, and reasonable by the glass, too. A tour of the kitchen conducted by Jacques himself and the fromage room just splendid. The breakfast looking out into the countryside  equally a delight. The hotel itself built into the side of the Auvergne hill is so interesting and rooms so comfortable. Perfect. Well worth the cost. Travel to little St. Bonnet Le Froid and enjoy the total experience.

Author: BibouHunter
Content: Nested in the middle of nowhere, there is little chance that you come to the village by chance. Like Vonnas and Georges Blanc, the village lives thanks to the Marcon. At the entrance, there is a nice bar, and you can buy souvenir or food in one of the shops. And the village keeps its true character. If you do not have the chance to have a room in the main hotel, no problem. We stayed in the Clos des Cimes and everything was nice. The restaurant is some hundreds meter from the hotel but there is a limousine service that takes you to the restaurant and back. So, you can let your own car in the dedicated parking for the night.   The dining room is very elegant, and the view is just great. We were there for dinner but visited the dining room at daylight and the landscape is so beautiful and very changing (we had bright day coming and fog and storm the next morning when departing).  I suggest, as meals are prepared according to the seasons to follow the Maitre d‚ÄôHotel‚Äô suggestions, do not worry, all is just excellent, fine, well-prepared and good-looking. Staff is great, kind and very professional. The sommelier we had was very helpful and made us discovered some unknown designation. Among all 3 stars restaurant we visited, the Marcon is the one of the most exotic one which brings us a very refreshing break even in our own country.

Author: fanoffrance
Content: I've dined here several times over the past 20 years or so.  I've always liked it, but after the last couple of visits I'm geting the impression that the recipes are going off in a somewhat different direction, with very lightweight, gelatinous, frothy textures that don't really seem to satisfy my tastebuds.  It may be my own taste that has changed over the years, but the menu does mention that they are making an effort to serve light, healthy food...  Anyway, I find the cooking impressive, and I enjoy tasting all the various mushrooms, but the final effect doesn't quite hit the spot for me anymore.  By the way, be sure to reserve months in advance, it's hard to get a table!

Author: travellerNEEngland
Content: We always hope to visit this restaurant when we visit St Bonnet and have been doing so for many years.  I have already reviewed the restaurant several times, but feel that I should repeat my views, for me eating anywhere in the world does not get any better than this.    This really is the best meal I have ever eaten.    The menu follows the seasons and the traditions of this part of France.  It is not just the great food, lovingly prepared and to an extent based on local traditional recipes and produce, but the whole ambience.  Great food, great service, great wines, but without the pretentiousness of many one star or two stars in France, let alone three stars. Everyone can feel comfortable here.  The service here is immaculate, attentive and efficient, without being overbearing.  The dining room is wonderfully managed and the sommelier, so well informed and helpful.  If the food and service was not enough the location is superb, with views from the dining room over meadows and the Doux valley.  If you visit here keep your eyes open you may spot the red kite or other raptors soaring over the valley from the dining room.  This is the place I will always want to return to, as long as I can continue to travel.

Author: eunice_from_aberdeen
Content: We visited this restaurant at a friend‚Äôs recommendation and we weren‚Äôt disappointed! The whole evening was an amazing experience from start to finish. The staff were by and large very impressive, attentive and helpful without being intrusive. We decided to go for the full tasting menu with matching wines. The wines were delicious and matched perfectly but we would have enjoyed more description, albeit we appreciate our language differences may have been the reason for this. The food was amazing, with mushrooms playing a part in most of the courses. I wondered how someone who didn‚Äôt like mushrooms would fare but we were reassured that they would happily cope with this or any other dietary requirement. A highlight of the evening was a trip around the kitchen when we were able to meet the charming Regis Marcon. A night to remember. Thanks so much.  I have included only 3 photos. Most of my photos were taken after I started the course!

Author: A Voice Of Experience
Content: Well, we expected it to be special, and it was. It was always going to be a challenge for me, as a guy why simply detests mushrooms! That, in a restaurant who‚Äôs greatest Signiture Dishes are based around some of the very best mushrooms from around the world, you get the picture. I lost count after course number 10 but the whole experience was one that I can only hope I experience somewhere again as it was total perfection. From our arrival to departure, totally seamless and possibly in one of the most beautiful restaurants in the world. We stayed nearby but would recommend pushing the boat out all the way if you‚Äôre going up there as the accommodation looked exquisite. A simple recommendation- simply go if you possibly can!

Author: Lex
Content: A full overall experience for all of our senses - in all levels. Actually it is not describable but anyone should experience such a divine happening. Thank you so much... From the early evening to the end of all courses - I don't remember how many - late at night our small group was hosted professionally but with no pressure at all. In the moments we had a question somebody was right away with us, but we never noticed anybody waiting for us. The proposals of the servers were relaxed, friendly and always with a valuable choice. Even we were eating all the time and for hours we did not feel overindulged, and we were not hungry either... :-D

Author: Daniel M
Content: The food never ends and neither does the imaginative ways of presentation. We were visiting the town for the annual festival des champignons (mushroom festival) which is worth the considerable detour to find this cold little town.

Author: Ontheroadagainsoon
Content: One definition of a Michelin 3 restaurant is it is a destination. This one truly was for us. We were traveling Southern France and Switzerland and based on a friend's good raves, we sidestepped by a 3 hour drive and 24 hours of our itinerary to experience Regis & Jacques Marcon's restaurant and lodging. It is definitely a highlight of our entire trip and will be an everlasting special memory. To begin with the hotel was amazing. The pictures did not impress me so I was expecting to be underwhelmed. Instead I encountered minimalism but in the design hands of architectural genius. Even the parking garage was amazing! The meal also went beyond expectations. The food was creative and balanced and delicious, the service was attentive, and after 4 hours of eating what had to be 17 or more courses we were pleased to only have a few steps to walk to our room!  I am devoting another paragraph to give some help in getting reservations. The diners are mostly French and the staff is all French although most had a decent comfort with speaking English. However, I found the securing of reservations very confusing. Their website is only in French and all of their email communications were only in French. There is a restraint on advanced reservations. When I was finally allowed to make our reservations I could not find a way on the website to reserve a single night at the main lodging. I therefore sent an email and was promptly given confirmation of our lodging for 1 night and our dinner. (There is an alternative lodging but if you are going the distance go the whole way!) With the confirmation email which, again was in French, we had a very detailed instruction on how to secure the reservation. It involved going to our local bank and they had to transfer the money to the French bank. We have never had to make such a transfer for a reservation before and having it all instructed in French was difficult for us as well as for our banker! The good news is that we had an amazing experience.

Author: Newbedouin
Content: This is more an experience than a meal. Experimental flavours, incredible presentation, generous additions (we counted more than 19 'courses'). It's the sort of meal that stays with you for the next day in the memory of the tastes and textures. The only disappointment was that during the evening of our visit there was a lengthy power cut (2-3 hours). The staff ensured a fantastic atmosphere by candlelight and it's quite incredible that they managed to continue to cook and present such amazing food working by candlelight and cooking on gas in the kitchen. All the same, it meant some delays, which led to us waiting long periods in between the early courses, and being rushed through the final courses. In the end the meal we started at 8:30pm didn't finish until 1am. I credit the staff for continuing, and it didn't affect the quality of the food, but had we known in advance (the power cut was before we arrived) then I think we would have postponed, because we were so tired towards the end of the meal that we appreciated it less than we might have done. I would advise people to go for lunch, in order to enjoy an afternoon of culinary excellence without getting sleepy!

Author: Cedric L
Content: Visited Spring 2015. Hands down the best French meal of our lives, and certainly the most recommendable. Extraordinary quality and simplicity of ingredients at a relatively reasonable price (significantly cheaper than other 3 star michelin‚Äôs despite superior quality). No over worked presentation just obsession with quality. Massive Kudos

Author: A A W
Content: It is not easy to get here, if the 10 rooms at the establishment are booked other options are barely acceptable, but your efforts will be rewarded.  It is more than eating a great 8 course dinner.   You will be treated like an honored guest.  Both Marcons (Regis the son and Jacques the father) will greet you, you will be invited for a kitchen tour and be served and spoiled by an incredible crew of waiters, managers and sommeliers.  At 210 Euro, the meal is a relative bargain (comparable 3 Michelin star restaurants in Paris charge up to 350).  So, enjoy being pampered and having a true epicurean treat.

Author: Hilary C
Content: Fabulous dinner;  one of the best 3 star michelin restaurants we've been to, if not the best.  Other reviews have said it all.  No hesitation in recommending  this wonderful dining experience.

Author: Jarb46
Content: A superb meal with mushrooms as the theme. It was one creative delicious dish after the other. Service was impecable. Regis Marcon visited at the table more than once and took us to a tour of the kitchen. Spectacular views from the restaurant. An unforgettable experience. We are already making plans to return.

Author: 312659Coco
Content: We have just spent the most delightful evening at this exceptional restaurant in St Bonnet Le Froid! The ambience with glorious throne like wooden chairs and exquisite views started the evening on a high in this beautiful place! It is impossible to find expressive vocabulary to describe the food here where the mushroom is king! To any person who prefers vegetables to meat this is absolute heaven ! The attention to detail is phenomenal, every dish is an absolute work of art! The wine choice is of course extraordinary and our host new exactly what to order with the help of the sommelier! An unforgettable experience that can only be appreciated when you sit in that chair and taste the heavenly food! Many many thanks for an exquisite meal !

Author: heartstoyou
Content: Our experience at this restaurant was wonderful.  We selected the middle menu with about six different courses.  Each course was a surprise for the eye and mouth.  We were not disappointed.  My husband mentioned that we were celebrating our anniversary upon our arrival in casual conversation.  We were utterly surprised when a small, delicious cake arrived after desserts with a lighted candle on it.  It was super!    We were pleasantly surprised when our host, Regis Marcon, welcomed us when we first sat down and later thanked us for our visit.  He is a very charming man.    My only negative comment is that the wait staff was a bit too brisk when setting the table for the next course and a bit too quick and noisy when walking back and forth to the kitchen.  It is unpleasant to feel the disturbance of air because of this quickly and it was distracting to the ambiance.

Author: oliweraar
Content: hidden a bit off the mainroutes from North to south you will find the Hotel and Restaurant in a beautiful scenery. the Food is each time extraordinary. our second visit was fantastic again. great Service, too (we even met our very Kind Server in the knifeshop in thiers the next morning by coincidence).

Author: Petit Passeport
Content: Dinner was amazing. If you like mushrooms, you will not be disappointed by dinner from the "Mushroom King". If you don't like mushrooms, this place will probably convert you into a lover of mushrooms. The final dessert at the end of the meal was like the finale of a fireworks display -- it just kept coming and kept getting better and better. Truly special.

Author: belaril
Content: Enjoy a pure moment of bliss. You can't imagine where theses chefs will take you with mushrooms !! Imagination, talent, perfect technical mastery, this is French cuisine at the top. Great service, quick tour of the piano and discussion with the son, that will explain his search for sustainable cooking.  A must to visit, worth the drive !

Author: fanoffrance
Content: One of the specialties of this fine restaurant is the local mushrooms, which of course are available in abundant variety in October.  I was served a little frying pan containing an assortment of delectable mushrooms, and the chefs also used them to good advantage in the recipes.  I've dined here 4-5 times over the years and have always been satisfied.  The standout dish for me this time was the perfectly cooked rouget--one of the two best fish dishes I have ever eaten--with its tender, juicy flesh and crispy skin, accompanied by delicious sauces and vegetables.  The cooking style in general is light and airy, without much fat; still, I ended up feeling stuffed after a "small" menu, and the couple at the table next to me had to ask their waiter to omit a considerable portion of the (larger) menu they had ordered, because they were already full!  There are a lot of little extras along the way, so I think the chefs need to scale down the quantity of food served here.  The dining room is spacious and comfortable, featuring large windows that offer a pleasant view of the hills and forest during daylight hours.

Author: travellerNEEngland
Content: It does not get any better than this.  The restaurant sets superb standards for food, service and comfort.  We hope to visit this restaurant on every visit to the village of St Bonnet.

Author: nobuhiro k
Content: My wife & I stayed at Clos des Cimes which belongs to this group. When comfirming my reseravation, they offer that the seats are available for dinner, and I accepted it immediately, of course. There is limousine service to and from the restaurant. The car is not limousine but big luxury SUV. Driver took us to the restaurant reception. Restaurant is gorgeous and should have panoramic view in daytime. In consideration of our appetite & capacity, we will order 2 or 3 dishes course, but floor manager highly recommended 'Tasting course'. He said they can prepare small portion for each dish. He was right. I could enjoy from starter to dessert with greatest satisfaction. When the starter was served, I was really surprised, not was impressed. In my impression, it will show picking nice food from the forest. Following it, all did not betray may expectation. During the course, we are offered kichen tour. It was very impressive as well. He, Chef Regis, has absolute confidence for his policy.  Dinner ended up around 23:00. Next morning, when I had morning walk around our hotel, big SUV stopped in front of Bistro and a guy got out. He was Regis and after I said hellow to him, he went into the Bistro kitchen. He must be a hard worker.

Author: StephaneTreppoz
Content: We went there for dinner and one night at the Relais & Ch√¢teaux hotel. We took the discovery menu which comprises of six courses (properly sized so that you enjoy each and every one) + cheese + dessert not including mignardises and a couple of other surprises. The meal was outstanding be it for fish, meat and of course vegetables (asparagus, forgotten vegetables...) / mushrooms (morels) which are a local specialty. The waiter offered a visit of the kitchen where the chef and the entire squad work with razor sharp efficiency and smile  The dining area oversees the mountain and it is beautiful and peaceful to look at. The architecture of the building is a mixture of modern style and more local treats. You are in the middle of nowhere in the mountain (1.200 m high) with fog pretty often which gives a rather surealistic touch to the experience that my wife, my father and I loved. As we said during dinner, this is in restaurants like this that you experience what "the Genius of French cuisine" is. Even though this is an expensive meal (you are in a 3-star Michelin restaurant), you pay a fraction of the price that you would pay in Paris for the same experience. You can run there for a 24-hour romantic getaway eyes closed! The rooms of the hotel are very cosy as well. we will most definitely come back.

Author: Sebmtb
Content: We had the pleasure to stay overnight at Regis & Jacques Marcon as well as spending a meal in their wonderful restaurant. Everything from the views (both in the room and the dinning-room) to the overall feel of quality in the place is remarkable. Food is breathtaking, the tasting menu, recommended by the restaurant manager, is worth every penny. The service is flawless and the dishes (about a dozen) come and go at a very steady stomac friendly pace, We spent 4 hours dinning and it did not feel that long at all, the theme is clearly "mushroom everything" and the chef is truly a master when it comes to cooking them and making them part of the experience (you even get mushroom shaped sugars with your coffee!). Pricing is high as you'r dinning in a 3 michelin stars restaurant but compared to a similar place in a big capital city it isn't bad at all.We only found one thing a bit odd, none of the silverware was polished, it was very strange for this kind of establishment but maybe there is a eco concept behind it (the entire hotel complex is built with green sustainable enery in mind)?

Author: TOURtheWORLDMexPal
Content: It is ‚Äúusually‚Äù once in a life time experience. Make reservation way in advance, save money (lot of it) and be prepared to the amazing journey and experience of almost 5 hours.  The seasonal tasting menu (11 courses) with extra signature dishes is what we tried and loved.  I highly recommend the rarity wine pairing, both the Nebbiolo and the champagne‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ the food is PERFECT but the Wine will exceed your expectations as it is very rare and meticulously picked, not to match the food, but to enjoy usually in between courses for the full appreciation of the wine selected.  Service: the best you can get in Italy‚Ä¶.. To be greeted by the chef himself and take pictures with him and while signing your menu, is just an added bonus to an excellent experience.

Author: JonCNYC
Content: Don‚Äôt go if you aren‚Äôt Italian unless you want to be treated as a second class guest. The food was very good but the service was horrible. Giuseppe, the maitre d‚Äô, was rude and totally not professional. Another guest got up from her table and was having a cell phone call for several minutes a foot from where I was sitting. We asked if he could ask her to take her call in another place and he said no, he could not do anything about it. I asked her if she could continue her call somewhere else, she immediately apologized and finished her call in the lobby. Giuseppe was rude and unfriendly from that point forward.

Author: RorschAch
Content: Excellent experience of white truffle season  On the one hand, from the side such as service quality, number of wine or champagne and food it can be called such as perfect. And the head chef is 8 1/2 Otto Hong Kong‚Äôs friend. On the other, the price for white truffle is 12 euro per gram and of course it is almost the double price if you compare it with other which is sold on truffle markets, but the quality is much better than later one. By the way,the photo 1 is panama geisha 2022 the best in the world

Author: Richard H
Content: I am truly at a loss for words.  We had ‚ÄúThe Journey‚Äù.  I can‚Äôt imagine a better experience‚Ä¶which is how it should be when you dine at a 3 star Michelin restaurant.   If we return to Alba, we will come here again

Author: Robert T
Content: Excellent service,food and wine would deserve  a better room and atmosphere. Unfortunately our total experience was reduced by pool acustics and reverberation.

Author: Heap73
Content: All good as you expect from a 3 stars Michelin restaurant. We missed a pinnacle to make the place and the experience memorable, which is what you expect from the 3 stars. Otherwise it‚Äôs just one of many places with great food. Sommelier was very good and helpful. Location is nothing special.

Author: andreadecillia
Content: Piazza Duomo may have been with DiverXo the best meal of my life. Crippa was a former Marchesi alumni and worked during his career with Michael Bras, Ferran Adri√† (just to name a few) and in Japan, which all had an important step in his career, this is well reflected in his food but also in the decoration of the restaurant.   Everything could be characterized by a perfect juxtaposition of balance while still challenging the diners' expectations. Ingredients are of best quality, locally sourced and perfectly executed. Crippa is managing to elevate simple ingredients to an explosion of flavors. My favorite dish? The Borscht soup, amazing!  The wait was perfect, engaging without distracting from the food, very knowledgeable, and worked together as a seamless team perfectly.  The overall experience is a journey in the unexpected. Simply a masterclass in food as an art.

Author: westy54
Content: This was our third visit to this outstanding restaurant, however instead of gorging ourselves on the large degustation we opted for the four course luncheon degustation for Euro130-00 per head. There was a choice of an optional dish (at an extra cost of from Euro20-00 to Euro40-00) from four dishes and you could also do wine pairing for Euro90-00 each.  This restaurant is on the first floor of a building that overlooks the Piazza Duomo and has its entrance off a small side street. the Vicolo dell'Arco. The interior is modern and chic with pink walls.   Our four course luncheon degustation started out with nine amuse bouche/starters There followed our additional option dish called Salad 21..31..41..51 (Euro40-00 each) that amazingly had over 80 different salad ingredients. After a short break we started the main menu with Codfish, almond and lavender, zucchini and clams, followed by Rooibos risotto, Duck breast Marrakech and for dessert, Yoghurt and honey. Interesting coffee and tea menu (Coffees Euro10-00 each). Coffee came with 6 different petit fours each. We thoroughly enjoyed every dish, the range of which really set tested the taste buds. Some dishes better than others but not a miss amongst them.  Wine list was a tome. Our bottle of 2018 Barolo from E Pira & Figli was Euro150-00 and excellent.  Service was exceptional. Staff were attentive and explained all of the dishes well.  As we left we met the genius behind it all, Enrico Crippi.  This is fine dining at its best though it is not cheap. Two aperitifs of sparkling wine (Euro32-00), lunch, additional salad option, two bottles of water, wine and two coffees came to Euro572-00.

Author: Verona
Content: Compared to other Michelin 3-star restaurants, I was stunned at the bowls of single bites.  This was much ado about nothing.  I found the experience to be lacking when it came to flavors without a take-away memory of the most expensive meal I've ever had.  Furthermore, I felt like the paired wines did not compliment the bites.  It was as if they were cleaning out the cellar.

Author: phil fort wash
Content: Piazza Duomo deserves its Michelin stars- the food, wine, service and ambience are all first rate. Our party of 4 thoroughly enjoyed the tasting menu with accompanying wine pairings. There is something to satisfy every palate and the chef was very accommodating with respect to dietary restrictions (let them know when you make the reservation).  The tasting menu has 8 courses, plus an amuse Bouche and bonus dessert. Portion sizes are appropriate for the number of courses, so that one can enjoy all of the items without feeling overwhelmed. While it is hard to pick highlights, for me the standouts were the ‚Äúantipasto piemontese‚Äù and the ‚ÄúGavour‚Äù. We also added their signature dish, the ‚ÄúSalad 21,31,41,51‚Ä¶‚Äù Overall a fine dining experience not to be missed.

Author: Noh Leftovers
Content: We visited Piazza Duomo for my birthday last year and it was a good dinner. Here was the menu for the Barolo Tasting Menu  - The Aperitif of Turin - Winegrover‚Äôs Salad - L‚ÄôAlbese - Snails and Polenta - Risotto Rooibos - Cardoncello Mushroom - Podolica - Pumpkin Seeds and Malghesino - Profiteroles - Cavour Biscuit & Zabaione

Author: Martins D
Content: When you go to top 50 reztaurant with 3 Michelin stars - the level of expectations is quite high. We got the reservation bu chance since we are staying in the region and did not plan the visit ahead. Very professional service, great choice of wine (we took the house Barolo - very elegant and reasonably priced too). The dishes were an inspiration - play with textures, ingredients, and truly a visual experience - more like art when it comes to serving. Probably best sea urchin i had. Very nice art collection

Author: ingconti
Content: We were there on 30th dec 2021, to anticipate new Year's Eve dinner. it is a 3 starred restaurant so expectations are high (this is our 4th 3 stars restaurant).  A bit disturbing to be placed on a list to be admitted and giving credit card in advance... (we have already experienced he same at Gordon Ramsey years ago, but we cannot appreciate it...)  To be clear: it's a very good place with high levels of services and cousine, but in this palce every details counts. We ate all coures with truffle added..  PRO: - service is very good - course are cared and very well presented. - wine list is remarkable - sommelier, even if very young, is a clever and smart lady. - at the end the chef did appear to thank hosts: a gentle touch. -truffle is very good. nice interiors. - to be a 3stars, price is interesting (we spent a similar price at 1 starred in Milan... (see review..)  CONS: - fixed menu: in a 3 stars we can expect the cook for us following our desires,  a bit rough we had to eat their proposal without knowing them in advance. - place is a bit hidden: address is "piazza duomo" but we and other hosts failed to find it: is in a small street near. - usual un-polite strangers: the chat aloud, and maitre did not say a word.. :( - we honestly expected more from a 3 *.

Author: Yukari K
Content: Piazza Duomo marked the end of two solid days of eating white truffles throughout the area - this is our fourth trip to Alba. We were at Piazza Duomo with a friend and of course we ordered the truffle menu. The first thing we were astonished by was to learn that the 270 euro price did not include the price of any truffles, which were charged by each gram we used. The price of the truffles was 13 euros a gram, more than 2x the street price (the price charged at well-reputed trattorias), which seemed egregious. Our Italian friend who eats in Alba every year was shocked by this system.   Needless to say, their "generosity" shaving truffles on our dishes seemed more extractive than generous (whereas we left a meal the previous night with the exact opposite impression of a restaurant that included the truffle cost in the price of the menu)  Most of the dishes were very good, and the chef's reputation is well deserved. There was only one dish that missed the mark. Like so many other chefs, this chef also tried to pair truffles with chicken, perhaps to marry the simple with the sublime? Either way, it rarely works, and his dish didn't either. He actually had a delicious marsala sauce on it that married well with the flavor of the truffles. We all scraped the sauce off the chicken and ate that with the truffles. We ate the chicken separately.  The chef is reputed to be known in Italy for his experience in Japan, and he is known to marry the east with the west in his cooking. As a Japanese national who is intimately familiar with Japanese cuisine, I must say that I saw little trace of that influence. His weakness in fact appears to be vegetables, even though that is a big element in Japanese cuisine (to be fair we did not have the salad he's supposedly famous for). There was one savory custard dish that was stunning that could possibly have  been influenced by the Japanese chawanmushi though it also could have been a variation of the sformato.   The biggest issue here is the service. We found the wait staff to be pushy, impersonal and lacking in knowledge. The descriptions of the dishes were perfunctory at best, a recitation of the ingredients. Chefs that produce dishes of this caliber usually like to share the story about the source of the ingredients or the intentions behind the dish, but the descriptions were little more than a recitation of the ingredients. We also would've expected the servers to be a little more excited and engaged in the dishes, but you almost got a sense of boredom from them. Incidentally, when my husband went to the restroom, he saw three of the servers chatting amongst themselves with no attention on the guests.   At the end of the dinner, the server presented us with a menu for eight different coffees. When we asked for the difference between them, they were unable to tell us more than how one had the flavor of chocolate or another had a little more acidity than the others. Or that all of them were 100% arabica beans. If you are charging 15 euros for high-end espresso, they should have a little more information than that.   If you come here, you will for sure have a wonderful meal, but for us once was enough.

Author: Richard S
Content: Iam impressed- great service, great kitchen, food just incredible üëå and somilier choosed the perfect wine I have to say. Also interior, ambient, decoration, stuff and style just great. Also I have to say the glasses, specifically the red wine glass was an experience. I never saw so tiny and perfect handmade glass. They told its Austrian brand "Sophienwald". So really they care about every detail.

Author: bernardverheecke
Content: From beginning till the end was a total experience. Young but dedicated staff.Menu barolo with the wines included was heavenly.

Author: Michael K
Content: We took the white truffle experience. The products were good and well treated.  That being said, the dishes were very heavy, not balanced, and there wasn‚Äôt any calm dish to settle the heaviness.  Moreover, all the dishes were needed to be with the truffle, so the bill just whispered in the back of our ears.

Author: DMY
Content: Of all the restaurants that I had been to, which included more than fifty Michelin 3 stars, this is now numero uno on my list. Enrico is a most gifted, passionate and gracious chef, surrounded by a dedicated team. We had the most amazing white truffles dinner last night and are still tasting the sublime flavors and inhaling the intoxicating aroma of the food from 24 hours ago. You can book your stay at the lovely B&B - Casa Agnese, that is walking distance to Duomo, then you can drink to your heart‚Äôs desire and walk back afterwards üëçüèªüëçüèªüëçüèª

Author: wrldwonder
Content: Our second visit to Piazza Duomo and the place is very special.  Incredible servers, fantastic, creative dishes and a beautiful room added up to one of our most memorable meals.

Author: Kevin
Content: We were on a trip through Europe on our honeymoon and spent the last day here in Alba so we decided to have lunch at Piazza Duomo. This experience was simply amazing and from start to finish we were in complete awe of the service and food.  We made reservation well in advance and were greeted by a great team of people.  From that point on we were just blown away.  The wine list was extensive, easy to navigate and well laid out.  As far as the food goes there just aren't enough adjectives to describe it.  We ordered the Insalata 21, 31,41, 51...., the herb encrusted lamb loin and a pasta dish with chunks of fresh seafood but so much more came out!  Beef tartare  that was disguised as olives, an array of little dishes with little treats and so much more!!! We could have not ended our honeymoon on a better note.   (Side note we were here in April of 2019 but it would not allow us to go back when we actually visited)

Author: Italian_in_Boston
Content: Best 3-Michelin stars restaurant in a long time. It was my third time, but the first one during the white truffle season - amazing! I picked the white truffle menu with wine pairing, which is perfectly balanced.

Author: anna z
Content: We had the chef's table. The food was good but nothing to write home about. There wasn't even a dish we would expect in a 3 michelin star restaurant. The wine pairing was good but again, nothing impressive. The sommelier though was very knowledgeable and was trying to surprise us everytime.  For the price you pay, it's not worth it unfortunately.

Author: Value4Price
Content: Upfront, the food is terrific, delicious, creative and width the money. We had the 10 course version and where very pleased by the food and  impeccable service.   The only annoyance was the.sommelier who continuously was discussing loudly with other guests without using a face mask. We though that it's mandatory in Italy at present. His long and loud conversations did disturb the nice ambience. All other service members used them and showed great respect.  The excellent good and terrific other service personnel made up for the disturbing, though.

Author: Trish V
Content: Our dinner at  Piazza Duomo was the highlight of our trip and proved their 3 Michelin stars are well deserved.  This is truly a fine dining "experience" full of the pagentry one should expect  in such an establishment.  Every amuse bouche, every course, every wine was a palate-pleasing,  taste sensation, and a spectacular pleasure for the eye.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

Author: Buonador
Content: We are not enthusiastic about molecular cuisine, however in Piazza Duomo we were fairly bowled over by the quality, passionate preparation and delicious taste of the dishes as well as the well-groomed and well-instructed service personnel. Our unique dinner was a pure pleasure!

Author: RorschAch
Content: Joan Roca i fontan is known as the founder and chef of El Celler de Can Roca restaurant, awarded three Michelin stars in 2009. In 2013 and 2015, it was named the best restaurant in the world by 50 best. His well-known cooking techniques such as perfume, sous vide and distillation come from a chocolate pie that his grandmother Montserrat Fontan√©, who is still the chef at Can Roca (opened in 1967), cooked for him when he was a child. It was this ordinary chocolate pie that started Joan Roca i fontan's culinary career for more than 20 years and taught science and cooking courses at Harvard University. In 2015, the World Economic Forum invited him to become a member of the Cultural Leaders Council and an ambassador for the United Nations Sustainable Development Programs. ‚ÄúIt is the place we grew up, amid the hubbub of dishes, pots and pans, and guests‚Äù-Joan Roca i fontan Wine pairing selosse 2005

Author: HT1
Content: Once I knew that I was going to be in Girona for a few days I added my name to the wait list and to my surprise got a call about two weeks before offering me a table.  I accepted with excitement.   While overall it was a very pleasant experience, I did feel it fell short in a few areas to live up to the reputation it holds.    There was several wow moments with the food, but it got a little laboured near in the end.   Perhaps there is too many dishes and too much richness?    For me, I felt that the service dissapointed.   It felt cold and too rehearsed.   Often the next course was already waiting on the side while I was eating the previous and it was swapped over too quickly for me.   I accept clockwork was necessary due to the volume of dishes but it all felt a littled pressurised.    I declined the wine pairing (purely on the basis of the volume involved) and prefered a few special glasses of wine along the way.  I dont think this was appreciated by the Sommelier and I was forgotten.   When I would get their attention, it was often several courses later before being servered.

Author: Shirley H
Content: My friend and I spent 4 days  in Girona. Amazing food and cultural visits. We went on a Games Of Thrones Tour. Our guide was Brilliant

Author: Rajamora
Content: This elegant but ungrandiose 3-Michelin star dining establishment a joint continuing hospitality project of the three Roca brothers Joan (head chef), Josep (sommelier) and Jordi (pastry chef) , built on the foundation of their parents‚Äô modest restaurant featuring Catalan cuisine.  The 45-customer restaurant continues the Catalonian focus but given spectacular depth and scope by Joan‚Äôs adaptive creativity.  Feasting on a signature degustacion offering like, say, the ‚ÄúFestival Menu‚Äù that we enjoyed, the questing diner understands why Joan‚Äôs impressively realized gustatory imaginings made El Celler de Can Roca one of the only four restaurants with multiple ‚ÄúBest Restaurant in the World‚Äù accolades - at par with Napa‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe French Laundry‚Äù with two, and only behind the legendary ‚ÄúEl Bulli‚Äù and Copenhagen‚Äôs ‚ÄúNoma‚Äù at five Firsts each.  The lagniappe to the experience was to encounter Joan himself three times during the night and engage him in increasingly playful interactions.  There is nothing like a great chef unencumbered by grandiosity but crowned with a wonderful sense of humor.

Author: Anna M
Content: We travelled to Girona specifically to visit this restaurant.  We were so excited to get a reservation and built our trip around this visit.  We wanted to visit after seeing the Chef's Table episode on Netflix and were expecting something very special.  We have been to many Michelin restaurants with a few 3 star under our belts.  This experience was very average and does not align with what one would expect for a 3 star rating.  It was awkward from the moment we entered where there was no one at the front to greet us and we stood around looking for someone to help us out.  We thought maybe we came through the wrong door!!  Not a single question was asked of why we were there (Anniversary, Birthday, etc.) , where we were from, etc..  The restaurant itself is very nice - very comfortable setting with a beautiful natural landscape in the center and nicely spaced tables.  After sitting we waited a while again for the menu and water service, which in Europe I am OK with, but for a place like this it is not acceptable.  These are little things, but definitely not what is expected for a restaurant at this level.  We were at Disfrutar a few nights earlier and the service was exceptional and they made a real effort to appreciate that you were at their establishment.    As far as the menu goes we opted for the short menu - our mistake - if you do go be sure to get the longer experience because the timing isn't much longer and some key dishes are missing from the short menu - especially the desserts.  The food was good but nothing was exceptional.  Execution and quality of the ingredients is what you would expect, but nothing was good enough to talk to your friends about.  In fact, the main meat dish, which was a take on a beef Wellington, but used poultry elements was just not good and not incredibly original.  The ratio of the dough to the filling was off so there was more crust than needed and not a very tasty execution of the proteins.    The biggest letdown was the desserts, the primary reason we came, which were very average.  The first dish was an ensemble made from sheep's milk - this was pretty good and had a cone that had the scent of a sheep which made it kind of fun.  The next dish was confusing.  It was supposed to be a take on the memories from reading books, I think, where the aroma is supposed to based on the smell of old books.  We were given a splash of oil on the hands that was supposed to be this scent, which you licked before embarking on eating the dish.  The dish was not interesting and did not provide any sort of continuity both in flavor or texture and did not seem to align with the theme that was explained to us.  The dish also did not go well with the first dessert because both desserts were pretty heavy milk based recipes.  Finally - in fear of sounding pretentious, when I went to go to the restrooms I was super confused on where they were so I walked back and forth across the mirrored walls looking for the door, which ended my night in a similar way that it started - awkward...  Most Michelin restaurants walk you to the restrooms and ensure that you know your way around.  Our opinion is that El Celler de Can Roca is at a Michelin level but definitely not worth a special trip nor did the service or food stand out as anything special.  We have had more creative dishes both in presentation and flavor at many other restaurants and service was not on par with the other 2 and 3 star restaurants we have visited.  Even many of the one star restaurants had a more immersive and welcoming experience than El Celler de Can Roca.

Author: Greg T
Content: We've tried for two years to get a booking as we've lost out to the bots, so we had high hopes for our one-year wedding anniversary dinner after staying up until midnight to get this booking (we got married near Girona, so this place had a lot of meaning.) We also chose to have our wedding dessert from rocambolesc last year so this restaurant meant so much to us. We actually told the staff this, and they didn't care at all!!!!. The last 3 Michelin-starred restaurant we ate at was H√âL√àNE DARROZE last month, and wow, did they bring out all the stops!!! (they made a special newspaper for us and as soon as we entered they told us how grateful they were to choose them to celebrate our lunch with them. From the moment we entered their restaurant, we were made to feel so special. At el celler de can rocca, however,  no one was made to feel special that we could see, especially us! . We chose to celebrate our one-year wedding anniversary here, and we truly regret this decision. We had even said before we would bring our wedding party back here for our ten years - sadly, we wouldn't even come back for petit fours.   When you choose to save and spend your hard-earned money at a 3-Michelin starred restaurant, which is at least ¬£1000 for a couple, you would hope that you at least get greeted well. They couldn't even find out booking initially!   The food, in all honesty, was pretty boring, void of fun and personality, and everything had a foam or emulsion that tasted the same.  I've never felt the need to say something in a place like this, but I was so frustrated at the lack of attention to detail. When I excused myself and asked to speak to someone, I was met with excuses of how they were going to bring out a dessert for us. However, it was a little too late. The effort should have been made from the moment we arrived. I appreciated the apology, but it wasn't really heart felt.   This restaurant has no business holding three Michelin stars! That extra star is reserved for the wonderful restaurants that go the extra mile to make their guests feel special and appreciated.   I had hoped something special would happen at the end the meal to make up for the truly poor experience but it did not manifest.   take your money elsewhere to restaurants that do not rely on reputation.    A real, real, really wasted evening!!!!!!!!!!

Author: LoSALVA
Content: . . . It really is the best restaurant in the world. . . The experience is worth it. . . Excellent Tasting Menu with Pairing an opportunity to try food and drinks that you would otherwise not be able to access. . . One of the things you have to do at least once in your life. . . 100x100 experience recommended. . . Realment, √©s el millor Restaurant del M√≥n . . . L'experi√®ncia val la pena . . . Excel¬∑lent Men√∫ Degustaci√≥ amb Maridatge una ocasi√≥ per probar menjars i begudes que d'una altra manera no hi podries accedir . . . Una de les coses que s'han de fer almenys una vegada a la vida . . . Experi√®ncia 100x100 recomanable . . .

Author: Wheretonextandbeyond
Content: Wow! The whole experience at this restaurant is sublime! The food, the service, the spectacle, the ambiance! We could not fault it! It‚Äôs definitely a special occasion restaurant as the price indicates but was certainly worth every penny‚Ä¶loved everything about it and the icing on the cake was all three brothers were there and came to meet us at our table ‚Ä¶what a lovely addition to a fantastic lunch

Author: RorschAch
Content: How great it is!! The seasonal menu is an excellent and we combine the tasting and festival menu together.  Thanks for all staff and chef. See you next time.

Author: Ile1
Content: I know it‚Äôs a surprise to everyone, but‚Ä¶ It was not special experience‚Ä¶ We have been Michelin star restaurants around the world and it was not even close to be in top 10. Reason is simple: Too many people in the same time so service was not in 3 Michelin level. But anyway it‚Äôs once in a lifetime experience, so now we know the reality behind the hype. Anyway all the best for youüôè

Author: Maria C
Content: Lovely city and place! You must go, and enjoy de atmosphere, good meal and good wine.  Very beautiful city, near Barcelona.

Author: troopytroopy
Content: These brothers do amazing job. Their perfect combinations of various dishes, is hust from another world! This place is like disney, you should visit once! We enjoyed every minute spent in this restaurant. Dishes are amazing. Must visit, book in advance (11month).

Author: Alan S
Content: Unbelievable feel so fortunate to have secured a booking. My wife and I attended on September 20 2023 for lunch. We chose the feast menu with matching wines and the whole experience was a flawless journey of flavour, aroma and texture that unfolded morsel by morsel over a 3  1/2 hour period. There is something refreshing about putting your inhibitions aside and leaving your experience in the hands of professionals who are at the top of their game. If you have the opportunity to dine at El Cellar De Can Roca you will not be disappointed. You will read the odd review regarding the cost, in my opinion the whole experience delivered on every level and although not cheap it was certainly value for money. BTW my wife and I also stayed at the Roca Brothers Hotel Casa Cacao, it was also a wonderful experience we would recommend to anyone visiting Girona..

Author: Tony E
Content: What can I say except there is a reason why El Celler De Can Roca and the Roca i Fontan√© brothers have won best restaurant Worldwide year on year and retain their coveted 3 Michelin stars with great pride, honor and much dedication and hard work.  El Cellar De Can Roca can only be described as a pilgrimage that all food lovers must try and experience.  The cuisine is central to the Catalan region and is inspired by the produce of the season.  The creativity and genius of the kitchen is outstanding and this flows through to the team at front of house.  When you entrust your passion and artwork to your team many chefs roll the dice, however not here.  The front of house team are as passionate, warm, friendly, engaging and their knowledge is breathtaking.  We feel honored to have experienced the generosity of spirit and cuisine.  Thank you to all the team at El Cellar De Can Roca and for the private tour of the kitchen after dinner.

Author: melandashfoodies
Content: Sorry for my belated review, I am playing catch up. Avid user of trip advisor but need to be better with adding my own reviews as it is such a useful tool.  It is quite easy to see why this restaurant is considered one of the best in the world.   The restaurant itself is beautiful and sat in a very unassuming part of town away from all of the hustle and bustle of Girona. Due to the upmarket design, it did feel a little stuffy to us, but it really is a gorgeous place and certainly did not hinder our enjoyment of our tasting menu.  The food is beautifully presented, stunningly tasty but for me,  having watched chefs table and the cigar course, I expected a bit more  theatre. That being said we were served an amazing course that rained to create a jus and this was stunningly presented and tasted divine!   The wine list was huge and we opted for a flight to go with our meal and all of the wines on it were lovely, as per the norm for restaurants of this calibre, there was wine for every taste and budget and the staff were attentive and friendly and were able to explain the dishes to us in English.  A great experience and I would recommend visiting here if food is your thing!

Author: James T
Content: This is everything you'd expect from a restaurant with 3 Michelin stars.  The food was beautifully presented with great professionalism and the occasional piece of theatre.  The initial sequences taking you on a gastronomic history of the three chefs' was fantastic: I particularly loved the "chicken muffin," which was no larger than a thumb nail but somehow managed to yield a different flavour of a roast chicken dinner every time I chewed it.  We opted for the Feast Menu with wine pairings, which the waiter described as the restaurant's "full experience."  We lost count of the number of courses but it was more than 10, especially when you count the pre-menu courses and the petits fours.  A very small glass of wine perfectly paired with each course was wonderful and meant we got to try many wines we would never normally drink.  The two burgundys (a pinot noir and an almost creamy unoaked chardonnay) were standout selections.  Other courses of note were the celeriac mille feuille, the textures of tomato, the macadamia rose with the helium strawberry foam (surely all restaurants should have a helium foam trolley?) and the grilled egg plant.  I would have like to have seen a cheese course given the otherwise enormous breadth of the menu.  The petits fours trolley was something straight out of Charlie & The Chocolate Factory and the theme was lovely to see repeated in the sweet shop in central Girona.  Service was excellent although the waiters sometimes talked a little too quickly to catch everything.  It's difficult for them as there are so many courses and timing for some of them is critical in order for the plate to arrive in the right state (foams, ice creams etc).  The waiters were very knowledgeable and able to have a conversation about every single thing on the menu.  The cost is naturally high but given haute cuisine prices in major cities and the very considerable amount of investment in the restaurant and the menu, prices were within the range I had expected.  A truly memorable experience highly recommended.

Author: Gerard Lopez
Content: What an incredible amazing lunch we have had here. We sat at a table from 12.45 h to almost 18.00 h and it flew by in a minute.  Excellent food , well served and explained by our very professional waiter Alex.  13 appetizers followed by the Feast menu of 13 plates may seem a lot but it‚Äôs not.  It‚Äôs the perfect amount , for the plates are quiet small , meant for you to tast each flavour without feeling full at any moment.  Highlight of the day was the kindness and availability of the 3 Roca brothers who took  time to take a photo with us and were kind enough to show us their kitchen.  Chapeau !!!

Author: Joanne P
Content: We were so looking forward to this and overall it was very disappointing compared to Arzak and Berasategui. We chose the smaller tasting menu (as I've learnt that I can't manage a 13-course one) - 230‚Ç¨ for 5 dishes and 2 deserts with 85‚Ç¨ wine pairing (8 wines).  There was complimentary house cava which I thought a nice touch.   Before the menu however there were some 15 amuse bouches, meaning I was feeling fullish and overloaded before we even started on it; one of these was sole on crispy skin which was like leather which I had to remove from my mouth into a tissue (and in the absence of a plate - they were served in a series onto a 2x2x2cm granite 'post'  - put in my bag for later disposal).  There were a couple of stand out dishes - the celeriac,  the langostine and the caramelised apricot.  Unfortunately the poularde star of the show was encased in brioche which was soggy inside. Some imperfections in the space as well - thin, loose-laid carpets which looked rumpled and had the rubber underlay showing, loose and grubby soap dispenser in the men's toilet. Not a 3 star experience.

Author: Chris L
Content: Second visit with friends. As fantastic as the first time. We went for the feast  menu with wine fight. What theatre! Food, wine & service impeccable. Visit if you ever get the opportunity.

Author: Oscar
Content: Service/Decor: The restaurant is beautiful‚Äîmodern, clean, and simply decorated without being sterile, the decor and natural lighting makes the place warm and inviting. The service is phenomenal, no request is too large. Everyone who assisted us (too many waiters, sommeliers, and other staff to name) were both professional and friendly. The entire service lasted four and a half hours, but was orchestrated magically. Plates and glasses were cleared without distraction, and courses were well explained. We were given a tour of the kitchen after asking, and Joan and Jordi both posed for pictures and signed our books we had purchased.  Food and Beverage: The feast menu is about 13 courses, but also includes about 15 appetizers. It sounds like a ton of food, but you are not rushed at all. Take your time, savor every bite and enjoy the moment. I had gastric surgery and was very worried about not being able to make it through, but I finished the meal along with a wine pairing. You may not love every dish, but this is not just food, this is art. Art may sometimes bother or challenge your perceptions, but take it as part of the experience. I was the only one at the table who chose the wine pairing, which was expertly presented with wines from across Europe. Every wine was delicious, and the pairing was explained well. I shared my pairing with my aunt, as I do not drink too much, but wanted to fully experience the offerings of all three brothers.  Overall, this is truly a once in a lifetime experience. Do not be intimated by the restaurant‚Äôs prestige, the experience is fun, challenging, delicious, and magical.

Author: CJ B
Content: Exceptional experience that is highly recommended. Andrea provided outstanding service. The presentation of the 20+ courses was immaculate. Everything was well-orchestrated and delivered. Phenomenal!

Author: Henry H
Content: My wife and I decided to travel across the Atlantic to dine here after being intrigued by the Chef's Table episode featuring Jordi Roca and the uber-talented Roca brothers who have made this restaurant into an amazing bucket list worthy experience.  As a frugal individual who does not typically spend my hard earned dollars frivolously, this splurge was absolutely worth every penny and then some. We thought this would be a once in a lifetime thing, but after what we experienced, we honestly hope to have the opportunity to come back here again sometime in the future. I would recommend it to anyone.  Our waiter, Pablo, and our sommelier, Cyril, were absolutely outstanding! I can't thank them both enough for making this an amazing experience. Their presentation and knowledge of the dishes and wines being served were exceptional. Thank you to both of of you for making this a most memorable experience.  If you want to experience a meal of a lifetime with impeccable service, please do yourself a favour and visit this restaurant; it is outstanding!!

Author: sakurabunny888
Content: Everything was great but the number of the dish were just too much. We chose 13 feasting menu. What started as great slowly turned to feeling very full and could not even finish couples of last dishes. We just wonder the necessity of having that many dishes. I think the dish could finish much earlier ie. around 8 dishes. It's more than enough in satifsying our palates and fulfilling our appetite. Afterwards, the dishes felt like a redundant. The venue, atmosphere and service was great. It is expensive but with the many dishes, it's quite a value for money

Author: LeFrequentTraveller
Content: Booked the restaurant 11 months before our forthcoming wedding anniversary and we weren‚Äôt disappointed  Ordered the 15 course feast menu, with 10-12 amuses and accompanying wines  Service was fun and informative  We enjoyed every course over the 4 hours of  foodie entertainment  Defo one of our top 4 meals we‚Äôve experienced and worthy of its 3* rating

Author: Elli Y
Content: Absolutely exquisite experience! From the moment we walked in to the moment we walked out everything was perfect! I have never been served as I was there, but the food....I've had better.

Author: svarstad
Content: Excellent food and service for a party of 5. Very attentive personnel. Fresh local products and rather inventive. Very nice presentation

Author: Brooke M
Content: A fantastic dinner and precious restaurant!  The service is impeccable, the food interesting and stunning, and the chefs are wonderful and so sweet,  along with our server. It's a small, cozy restaurant and we were so grateful  for the wonderful and kind service and experience.  The value compared to what you receive is spot on. A very welcome experience on a long food trip in Europe!

Author: xnicolebx
Content: This meal was easily one of the best I‚Äôve ever eaten. We had the vegetarian version of the pre fixe menu with the nonalcoholic drink paring.  It was remarkable.
