Content: excellent Michelin star restaurant in the center of Munich.  It is a lot less formal than other star restaurants in Munich, such as the Schwarzereiter. It has more of a Berlin vibe to it. Nevertheless, the experience is absolutely great.  We went for lunch and took the 5 courses menu, which was just enough, not too much food. I liked everything they brought to us, but the fish (perch) and the meat where just astounding.  In terms of drinks, they have a really nice selection of wines. You can go with Augustiner if you want to as well. We had a schnapps in the end that was really really tasty, though really pricy.  In terms of price, it's about what you can expect for a 1-star. The menu is cheaper if you go for lunch, by the way.  The only thing I didn't quite like: The chairs were a bit uncomfortable.

Author: BaliMatt
Content: All of us six (including two kids) were extremely satisfied with Mural at a recent dinner in September. From a very warm welcome, friendly and competent servers, and a fantastic five course dinner. I think I counted seven people working in the kitchen - I have so much respect for the people and the team that work so hard and at the highest level to produce these wonderful dishes.  We got nothing to complain about and  highly recommend Mural.

Author: Hugh ‚ÄûRed‚Äú O‚ÄòDonnell
Content: The Mural is a cool location in trendy industrial style. We went there for brunch, and unfortunately we were disappointed. First of all, it is not brunch at all, you order breakfast from the menu. The choice is very limited, fruit for example is not available, the prices are very high. Unfortunately, there is no lactose-free milk offered that I can expect in such a place. The quality of the food is very good, for this, a big praise.  But the price-performance ratio is not.

Author: borislevin
Content: A star?  Are you kidding?  Was there for lunch. One poor girl serving everybody and totally under water. Lunch quality was ok, but Schumanns will beat this any day for half the price. Wanted a bottle of wine - no way to get one.  Evening menu. A bit ridiculous and certainly not worth it.   I wonder who gives this a star...

Author: Lhamlin
Content: Delicious food, friendly service and beautiful presentation. Tasting menu and full bar. Wolfgang was a terrific waiter and they were able to change the menu to pescatarian for me. All spoke English well but menu is in German.  Cute neighborhood and art gallery upstairs

Author: Alina G
Content: The composition of the dishes was well rounded and absolutely delicious. We chose the 6 course menu option with wine pairing and cheese course in between. Each dish was a piece of art. Out of all courses I can highlight the cake with topinambur and sorbet.

Author: waiake1
Content: While the restaurant is a bit quirky, I find that in many high-end dining places.  The focus is meant to be on the food both its presentation and taste.  Having read some reviews, I had high expectations and they were met.  The locally sourced ingredients were combined in a way that is truly impressive.  The young chef in charge has a unique ability to create dishes that astound.  I visited the restaurant for dinner and lunch and the high quality of the product was consistent.  The dinner menu is an experience not to be missed.

Author: Rosanne F
Content: Simply loved the place. It suits the combination with the modern art museum. It‚Äôs cosy, modern, has a welcome urban atmosphere. Went there for lunch, friendly staff, delicious food. I wanted to make a picture of my lunch but totally forgot because of the experience. Next time I‚Äôll go for trying out the dinner.

Author: Patrick37064
Content: My wife and I recently completed a trip to Munich for Oktoberfest. On the last night of our stay I asked for a 'surprise' restaurant from the concierge and her exact words were, "You need to go to Mural before they get their first Michelin rating". So that evening we were off to find Mural.  Be warned that it is a little hard to find off a smaller back street and when you walk in it's not a grand restaurant with lots of money spent on furnishings. It's a small understated restaurant with young chef's doing something you do not expect in Munich. They are making crafted and creative tasting menus comparable to some of the best restaurants in the world.   I have eaten at Maido, Astrid y Gaston, La Mar, Rafael, and Central in Lima, Peru. Borago in Santiago, Chile. All are considered in the top 200 restaurants in the world and I have to say that the little startup 'Mural' rivals them in creativity and potential.  We asked to be surprised with the 8 course tasting menu with wine pairing. We were not disappointed. Like the best restaurants today, the ingredients were locally sourced throughout the Bavarian region. Each course was impeccably presented and the taste was equally satisfying. Woflgang explained each course and explained the wine pairing chosen with each course.   The guys at Mural are very creative and if you like the experience of a tasting menu, as opposed to a couple of BIG course for dinner, I highly recommend Mural. I think the concierge was right about the Michelin rating. Once this place is discovered by a larger audience it will get more and more attention.

Author: johastraveller
Content: Such a pleasant surpise! I didnt know what to expect from this restaurant hidden in a small side street in central munich! The food was exceptional! Small plates full of flavor! Wolfi adivsed us and explained everything in detail and even recommended a wine that possibly only a few know about! The young chefs are passionate and you can tell they love what they do! Highly recommended and wishing the team great success !

Author: Jef R
Content: Luke Rogers of Mural is a gem hidden in plain sight and Mural was my favorite meal in Munich (8th visit).   Thoughtful ingredient combinations included white asparagu, mini trumpet mushrooms, strawberries marinated in mescal and kohlrabi ash.  Wine pairings were creative and adventurous - I am no sommelier, but was very impressed with the marriage of food and grape.  Always fun to learn about esoteric German and French wines, and the team delighted with surprises including a beetroot digestiv.  The Mosaic team clearly has chemistry and enjoy their craft.  Head chef Luke visited with us three times to provide color as to his creative process and tasting notes.  We enjoyed dinner immensely - so impressed with food quality, culinary skills and the warmth and knowledge of the staff.    Really made this trip to Munich specal.

Author: Shortstep
Content: We had a four course dinner with inventive takes on octopus and deer, friendly service and Urban-hip ambience. I think this place has great potential to develop into a culinary watering hole.

Author: Max-Josef M
Content: We had a wonderful evening at Mural, one of the best dinner we had so far in Munich  Go for the 4 or 6 course menu, you will love it!

Author: Marcos R
Content: Restaurant in a special factory atmosphere. Good food. Sometimes too many different flavors on one plate. Very large wine list but French-heavy. There is certainly room for improvement. For example, a Jumilla. Very attentive and friendly staff! It was a great evening.

Author: AIN_Bln
Content: The idea to visit Mural came to my colleague and me spontaneously in the afternoon at a trade fair in Munich, when it was clear that we were no longer going to trade fair in the evening, but rather fine dining. Because the recommendation of the GM we consulted online sounded great and because luckily we were apparently able to get the last table for two, we chose Mural. What can I say, we didn't regret it. As Berliners, we were initially surprised when we entered the restaurant: Mural is/was "actually" the Muca museum bistro and the interior design is the best shabby chic √† la Berlin-Mitte, just like at home! The toilets are a little further away in Wedding or Friedrichshain (on the corner that hasn't yet been gentrified). The staff would also fit in in Berlin, but only at first glance, because behind the relaxed "Berlin look" there was not only super friendly and service-oriented staff (neither of which would be the norm in Mitte), but the sommelier in particular was not only knowledgeable, but also took great pleasure in explaining his selection, without lecturing, wonderful! The wine accompaniment was very Jura and natural wine-heavy (there is also a small but fine wine menu with wine by the glass, especially for rarities and GGs, and an extensive bottle wine menu), which doesn't really excite me, but here I have to admit that the combination with the respective course was pretty good. In general, the food: modern, but not forced, delicious, handcrafted and visually convincing. We were delighted across the board, only the cheese sauce for the mountain trout was a bit too hard, the delicious mountain cheese practically flattened the actually even more delicious fish. The rest, especially the pikeperch and the venison, were great. If it wasn't so far away, I would like to come more often.

Author: John G
Content: +a convincing concept, very interesting dishes, very well-crafted, excellent products.  +modern, industrial style, few tables  +lively, but not too loud.  +friendly and motivated waiters and waitresses (but they seemed overwhelmed to me, some of them were running around...) +cooks (not the boss) presented their dishes themselves, but one cook was extremely disinterested, just recited her little verse, an embarrassing moment (also strange that she wasn't wearing chef's trousers, but private (?) jeans). +sommelier: knowledgeable, friendly, funny. Good recommendation, clear price information (verbally) before ordering. A top man!  - no wine list (the sommelier said he was the wine list) - you can do that, but I would have liked to have had an impression of the selection - service was not very organized - who was responsible for us? Changed several times. we also had to point out after the greeting and the first course that we would like to order a wine (otherwise we would have just had an empty glass of sparkling wine and water...), everything got pretty hectic.  - the (sweet) dessert came without warning before the cheese course, even though we had chosen the cheese immediately beforehand (it was then explained that the kitchen could then clean up earlier); order is not a dogma for me, but this could have been announced, which is usually done, but was forgotten in our case (see above); sweet wine was kindly offered, but then we went back to the red wine and the cheese...  Conclusion: There was a lack of a head waiter/chef who had an overview. Amazing for such good cuisine and such a good concept. But I would go again.

Author: Tryggve Nielsen
Content: Welcome to Maaemo! Norways first 3-stars Michelin restaurant. A dinner at Norways  top restaurant without kids is something we had been eagerly looking forward to. Food, wine and service is good, but jokingly we told ourselves at the start of the service, what if this is actually being part of The Menu?   After finishing of the meal at the dining hall, we are led back to chill out lounge where we started. Coffee is served, but suddenly the friendly waiter which has treated us nicely throughout the evening, comes to our table and asks us to come for a tour to visit the kitchen. In the middle of serving hot coffee this feels a bit peculiar, and we ask to bring our cups with us. Not a problem at all! He shows us everything that is going on there, fridge, main kitchen, winters menu etc. We walk around, smile and ask questions to show interest in what is shown to us. We are a bit puzzled why this tour is actually given and don't really see the main point, but we chat along and remark to him and others how nice everything is.  Well back at the chill out lounge we are served dessert and more coffee. My wife asks, could I have decaf? Sure, we'll take care of this. But nothing happens. The night is still young, so I would like a drink and ask the waiter to see the drink menu. "Sorry, we don't have this". "Can I order a Macallan 25 yrs, I can see you have a bottle in the bar". "Let me check". The waiter comes back a bit later. "Sorry, we have stopped serving alcohol now". The clock is around 22.30. Wow, that was early.. suddenly the same waiter come back and start serving wine to the neighbouring table. So strange, we are denied but others are still served?!? We ask the waiter about this. "Sorry, but we can't serve you anything more. Based on your behaviour no more for you guys". "Sorry, what?" "Yes, based on bad things that went on at the kitchen tour, it's no more for you guys". "Ehhh, sorry what do you mean we did at the kitchen?" "You walked around with coffee cups, and your wife put her cup on the kitchen table" "Eh sorry what? We brought the cups back with us, and bringing the coffee with us was ok for you." "Sorry can't help you. No more alcohol for you". "Are you saying that we are drunk" "No." "Are you accusing my wife for bad behaviour?" "Ehh, sorry I don't know what to tell you" "But what is going on??" "Sorry, I'm not allowed to say any more". "Ok, we're out of here. Give us the bill and our jackets."   This is by far the worst experience we've ever had at a restaurant, regardless of number of Michelin stars.  A horrible rip-off without comparison, a total lack of respect for the customer, and an arrogant and rude behaviour with no limitation. Thanks Espen Holmboe Bang for a great night at your restaurant!!!! Spending 15K and then total humiliation from your waiters is absolutely worth the price. As we told the waiter while we tore the menu in two and threw it at his feet while we left, we will never visit this craphole ever again. More like Kafkas The Process than The Menu - the staff treat you horribly but no-one is able to tell you why. But please visit Maaemo if this is your cup of tea!

Author: Shiloh T
Content: try to write more on this later, but the main thing ! would call maaemo is amusing, because you'll eat there and be like "how on earth did someone think this deserved Michelin stars?" The service is fine, it's about what you'd expect at that price point, but not beyond. Don't go in expecting fun surprises, but your water glass will remain full and your napkin will (usually) be replaced when you get up and go to the bathroom. The food is so jaw-droppingly unremarkable you'll wonder if someone is playing a trick on you. I just finished dining there, and this was the big occasion dining experience of my honeymoon, and no joke the best things I had tonight were some broth and a nice little bite of brown butter ice cream. That's not acceptable at a such a price point. Do I regret going to Maaemo? Obviously, but at the same time, it was kind of funny and inspiring. It makes me want to work harder and now I'm quite certain that if I spent a few months preparing, I too could make a Michelin quality meal. Service: four stars, Food: one star.

Author: Amstraveler
Content: The hardest lunch choice is what to drink.  I‚Äôm normally a fan of pairing wines and Maaemo does what I really like and offers three different quality packages (at three different price levels).  But buying wine in Norway is a bit overextravagant under any circumstances - the NOK 16000 ‚ÄòHoly Grail‚Äô pairing, while it would undoubtedly have been divine, was no exception.  Many guests limited themselves to water but we went for a juice pairing which was an unexpected delight.  Mixtures like cherry juice with a hint of nettle and toasted hazelnut were surprisingly successful (especially when pairing a dish with hazelnut in the sauce) - I‚Äôll have a go at making some of the mixtures myself now.  Food (in the 14 courses) mostly superb, some merely very good.  For me the starters and main courses beat the desserts (three ice cream dishes perhaps one too many) with the signature oyster/mussel and king crab/reindeer combos as highlights. Coffee weak. Unlimited water.  Ambience superb, service formal and a little subdued but extremely attentive, around 10 tables each of 1 or 2 people when we were there.  Amusingly we sat next to one gentleman whose vacations consisted mostly of visiting the world‚Äôs best restaurants (and told everyone in earshot about his visits).  He felt the restaurant lacked a star performer on the service team (maitre d‚Äô or whatever) which was to him essential in a top restaurant.  Maaemo indeed works with a flat org structure front of house so for someone to whom a star performer out front is critical to their enjoyment - well go elsewhere or forget your prejudice and just enjoy the dishes.  No background music until the last couple of dishes were served.  Prices as advertised - very high; but that‚Äôs Norway for you.  Watch out when reservations open - I tried for supper the day of our visit and the restaurant was fully booked half an hour before reservations were supposed to open. Lunch was still available.  Maybe there‚Äôs a secret trick that increases your chance of success ‚Ä¶.

Author: Haitham A
Content: we were a group of 4, tried the tasting menu, the wine selection was amazing - overall the food is good and we reached a point that we cant finish everything. if you are vegetarian, they can twist the selection for you but you will not enjoy everything ( i am not luckily) , the wine was great, the cost was crazy expensive at the end but  I think it was worth the experience - friendly staff, nice experience of changing rooms for dessert and food, arrival was nice .

Author: DaGama80
Content: Outstanding design and ambience. The service professional even so maybe a little bit lacking genuin warmth, The food of course in general good as you expect from a 3* Restaurant, especially the oyster, the mackerel and their sliced lamb-suckling were delicious. Just compared to other 3* places most dishes were lacking elaborated details and surprises. The non alcoholic pairing was as well a little uninspired and starters (amuse bouche) as well as the sweets towards the end of the dining experience (the parts to be taken on the lower floor) a bit too simple ‚Äúsweet&fatty‚Äù and thus a bit disappointing. Maybe they are a bit too much reclining on old accolades and their fancy location.

Author: RorschAch
Content: Maaemo 2.0, a three-star Michelin restaurant in Oslo, Norway, is the only two three-star Michelin restaurants in Norway (also ranked 47th in the world in 2021). It reopened in 2019 and was awarded three Michelin stars. Its predecessor (which won three Michelin stars in 2016 but closed 9 years after its opening) is located above the train tracks leading to Oslo Central Station and is only 300 meters away from the old site. The name comes from the Old Norwegian translation of ‚ÄòMother Earth‚Äô, although its chef Esben Holmboe Bang is actually Danish. But since he has spent most of his culinary career in Oslo, his cooking style is to explore the flavors of local Norwegian ingredients. According to him, 85% of the ingredients come from within 30 miles of Oslo, and the rest of the seafood on the menu, such as wild salmon cooked in salt butter, comes from the pristine waters of the northern coast of Norway.

Author: ShannRob
Content: What a wonderful experience. From start to finish, the staff was kind, friendly, and attentive (we even got to go in the wine cellar when one of our waiters noticed us watching her select multiple bottles). This is our first experience at a Michelin rated restaurant, and it has set the bar high. The attention to detail, not only with paying attention to the guests, but the knowledge about the wine and food being served, was spectacular. So grateful we splurged for the experience.

Author: toohh2018
Content: The food was exquisite, and the evening was a beautiful experience. Even the chairs were comfortable.The only thing that disappointed us was that the head chef didn‚Äôt drop by to say Hello.

Author: DanielK
Content: The most amazing experience I've ever had in a meal. The service was perfect and everything we ate was terrific. A great way to taste Norwegian food with a modern approach.

Author: Book W
Content: On our recent trip to Oslo, our party of 9 made a reservation to this lovely 3 star Michelin restaurant and we loved the food! Every dish was wonderfully presented! The taste was exquisite. We have been to other michelin restaurants and this place deserves it‚Äôs 3 stars! Service was also impeccable.  It is hard to decide which dish we liked the best because all the dishes from appetizer to dessert had it‚Äôs own merits. Definitely worth a visit!

Author: P W 132
Content: Worst 3 Star ever‚Ä¶overpriced ($500 per person to start).  Food waaaaaaaay below 3 star quality.  Small bites were good, their oyster dish was very fishy, crab too salty, we asked for no mushrooms (and they said yes but had to remind-several times), there was a 30 min gap between one dish, we sent back a glass of merlot that was quite bad (from the Rhone) and rest of dishes very average.  Wine list not up to 3 star restaurant (but reasonably priced‚Ä¶for Oslo)-but we bought a 500$ Mersault which was quite good.  Very nice room.  BIG problem is Chef who thinks he is Guy Savoy (and is not)-they asked for feedback and we mentioned the above and Chef came to our table HOT and berated us-mentioning he did not have a microwave and suggested we could end our dining experience.  We gladly we took him up on that and saved a lot of money.  I have always believed that Norway is a kind and gentile place but when a 6 foot +++ Chef lords over your table and you have in your party one of the only non-white people in the restaurant you have to wonder‚Ä¶sorry Norway but don‚Äôt worry Chef is Danish.

Author: Rhett m
Content: This was our all time best dining experience. Cannot think of enough superlatives to describe it all. And the staff was friendly, welcoming and not at all pretentious. Thank you for making our experience to joyful and memorable!

Author: Paul B
Content: Fantastic flavours all the way. Hosted by friendly staff in comfort.  Simply a Wow experience.

Author: Michael U
Content: As the only Michelin 3* Restautant in Norway Maaemo carries a banner, "Mother Earth" in Finnish Chef Esben Holmboe Bang serves a menu focused on organic, biodynamic, and raw local ingredients with the end-goal being zero waste but no restrictions in terms of taste or technique.   Found in the Oslobukta neighborhood diners begin and end in the lounge while a high-ceilinged dining room utililzes organic materials and dramatic lighting to draw attention to an open kitchen working in near silence across 15 courses.  Danish by heritage, though Esben‚Äôs plates consistently pay homage to Norwegian traditions, it comes as no surprise that Dinner begins with Potato Lompe topped in Cod plus Horseradish before proceeding through bites including Foie Gras, local Cheese and raw Beef topped in Pine Cone Vinegar.  Occasionally giving in to "New Nordic" ideals, though Butter and Fat see Maaemo‚Äôs flavors trend more rich than its contemporaries, plates in the dining room began with smoked Vendace Roe perfumed by elderflower that paired beautifully to 2020 Benjamin Leroux Chassagne-Montrachet.  Benefited by faultless service, every staff member executing at the highest level of personal yet professional engagement, Scallops arrived next with tart Fruits preceding Bang‚Äôs iconic Flat Oyster with Blue Mussels and Dill that has been a mainstay since 2010.  Pulling back in terms of intensity with a subtle plate of Turnips and Nettles, then serving a recently added slice of Char in a complicated Sauce that vacillates from sweet to savory, the night‚Äôs ‚Äúmain course‚Äù featured half a roasted Quail with Plums and Sunchokes alongside golden Milk Bread and a decorative spread made from Mushrooms with Garlic.  Cleansing the palate with earthy Consomme, bold but nuanced and a good bridge to Dessert placing Rhubarb amidst florals, it is here that diners return to the lounge for Coffee and sweets including Maaemo‚Äôs historic Brown Butter Ice Cream and hot, sticky Cinnamon Buns.

Author: Harari Family
Content: What a great experience! The food was really good and we went for the wine pairing which was phenomenal. Every combination was a delight, and I was happy throughout. Chef and staff are all incredibly attentive and lovely. The styling is chic but it didn‚Äôt feel stiff. 10/10

Author: Connor M
Content: I had very high expectations for this restaurant based both on how people talk about it as well as their three stars.  Some of the staff were very friendly and some were just rushed and not very attentive.  When the food started coming it was pretty disappointing. Out of 14 courses I really only loved 6.5 of them. The ones that were good were truly spectacular, but to have less than half of the menu be great when you're paying top dollar is just unacceptable.  I really don't understand how they managed to get and retain three stars.  I can't recommend this place unless you're rich and cost doesn't matter much to you.

Author: pilot1953
Content: A true Michelin 3* place in the middle of the "Scandinavian-service-desert". Excellent food and wines presented and served by dedicated and motivated waiters who are professionals. If in Oslo... a must place for a special evening out.

Author: Ida U
Content: Mediocre service, very little wine, very disappointed and cannot understand this is a 3 star restaurant. Wrote an e-mail about it with no reply. Not good value for money and would not recommend it.

Author: EYCLee
Content: Had high expectations of this restaurant before arrival. Discovered that the chef was away in Shanghai to open a restaurant but to his credit the team did an excellent job in delivering a delicious dinner. The dining room reminded me of the restaurant in the movie The Menu but lucky for us we survived and left happily fed and contented.

Author: Sara Th
Content: Absolutely fantastic! Amazing experience! The service was superb and the food beyond. Would absolutely recommend to anyone visiting Oslo or live here. You can‚Äôt miss this!

Author: reisermedfamilie
Content: The only trouble with this establishment was finding the entrance, something that took a walk around the block, as we missed it at first glance.  It is discretely located on the corner of a block,  with an unassuming wooden door, where the only clue is a small brass plate above a door buzzer.   Other than that a perfect experience.  We found the difficulty in finding the entrance something to laugh about, not troubling.  Nonetheless, be sure to arrive a bit early, in order to locate the entrance. We appreciated being given a small folder with a  list of all of the courses, once  Once you buzz the door, you enter the vestibule where your coats are taken. Then you proceed to the "living room" downstairs, where welcome drinks and the first three to four courses are served.  Beautiful pieces of art to look at!  To describe these starters as an explosion of tastes would not do them true service.  These hors d√≥uevres are a carefully orchestrated gustatory  symphony of contrasting and complimenting tastes.  Be aware that the champagne costs extra.    After the starters,  you proceed to the dining room on the main floor, where several more courses are served, each one an experience in itself, with balanced combinations of flavours that I would not have imagined.  Each dish was lovely to look at, delightful to tase.  Then it is back to the "living room" to wind down with desserts.  The service was excellent, formal and highly attentive, yet still friendly and approachable with any questions.  The staff worked as a well-orchestrated team to ensure that the diners were served their courses with precision, and that any questions were answered. You can watch the cooks make the final preparations with precision.  We were a party of four, where I was the only one to take the wine package, which was very good, but perhaps a bit of a let-down given the price tag.  Nonetheless, I would probably go for the wine pairing again if I did it once more.  Be aware that each glass of wine is for about three courses.  One of the others took two glasses of wine, one white and one red, with the main courses. and were very pleased.  One member of the group  took a non-alcoholic beverage pairing which was remarkably good, an unconventional combination of ingredients that resulted in an impressive drink.  Yes, this experience does costs a small fortune, but it is worth it.  It was impressive on so many levels.  Be aware that this is a set menu.  I doubt that it would appeal to vegetarians or those with special dietary needs.

Author: 123bi456ro789
Content: I still cannot stop smiling when I think of what a good time we had at Maaemo. The interior, the decor, the atmosphere and last but not least the staff and the FOOD! I had been wanting to go since they opened twelve years ago but somehow I never managed to get a reservation and when I finally did, I had to cancel because of covid. But it certainly was worth the long wait. My husband and I could not even decide which dishes we liked best. Normally, we enjoy the starters, but it‚Äôs downhill from there because the main dishes are too large (and boring) when one would prefer to have more, and smaller, dishes to be able to taste more things. Not so here. Everything was perfect. And the dishes included all our favourite foods! We particularly enjoyed the innovative and creative takes on traditional  foodstuffs like the outstanding dish with reindeer hearts as well as the dishes with caviar from different sources. And pinnekj√∏tt more interesting than any I have had before. And lomper, shrimp, scallops, king crab, mushrooms and strawberries as well as  duck leg, beef, turbot, peas, quail and brioche and rhubarb. Even now, I am unable to say what I liked best. Interesting matching wines, too. And did I mention the outstanding staff? I was smiling all evening. Pure bliss.  Oops, I almost forgot. A good review needs something negative. Mhh, well ‚Ä¶ I couldn‚Äôt eat my second cinnamon bun. In retrospect, I would have loved to take it home. They were quite tasty, after all  Sorry, but this is all the negative I can come up with. The evening was simply perfect.

Author: Elisabeth S
Content: There's no doubt Esben deserves his three stars.  The culinary journey we experienced was one we will remember for a long long time.  The elegance of the whole restaurant that embraces you from the moment you step inside the doors is one of a kind.  The service is impeccable. The atmosphere delightful. From the fireplace, the furniture, the smell, the pleasant silence even though people were speaking.  And then the food!! From the first bite to the last, it was an explosion of tastes and texture beyond superb.   We will come again (just need to save up a little bit)

Author: Mary Ella Feinleib
Content: I was thrilled to get a reservation at Maaemo, the northernmost Michelin three-star restaurant in the world. I'm sorry to have to say I was disappointed. I expect any three-star restaurant to have pretensions about its food, but I found Maaemo beyond pretentious. The servers were nice enough but so formal that the effect was chilling. First we we were taken to a dimly lit basement room for our starters. I could barely see what I was eating!  As each of the five  one-bite starters were presented, the waiter recited the ingredients--each of the five seemed to have five ingredients!  Precisely one hour later (everything here is timed to the  minute), I and the other diners were escorted up  to the dining room. The decor was stark but attractive and there was was more light here. My waitress stood  at my table and recited the ingredients of each of the eight main courses. Again, she was nice, but stiff. Trying to lighten the mood, I asked, "So, what's the next course going to be?" "Oh, I can't tell you that ahead of time." (To be fair, she gave me a hint.)  The food itself was generally good, but only a few dishes stood out as excellent--disappointing for a three-star restaurant. And  I'm all for innovative food pairings, but the "shoulder of crab with reindeer heart" took this concept a bit over the top. I must say that every course was artistically plated. An hour and a half later, to the second, it was downstairs again, for dessert. I enjoyed most of the desserts more than I had enjoyed the starters.   Half an hour later came the check, which was exorbitant, but not inappropriately so. This was not my favorite restaurant meal, but it was my most interesting restaurant experience.  Maaemo, please lighten up a bit!

Author: mwhamburger
Content: when my friends took me there I had no idea that we would be trying 18 courses of incredible dishes (served on tiny little plates or bowls). This does all take a long time so be prepared to be there for a while. The food is simply exquisite as is the service

Author: A L
Content: An incredible experience.  Highly recommended (if you can afford it)  Like other commentators, I am also not a vegetarian  and when I saw the menu was skeptical. Well, it was awesome food throughout the dinner. Tasty and savors, tastes never tried before. The chef uses little known and local herbs, plants and vegetables,  masterfully combined in delicious dishes.  Portion and the menu are well balance. Service excellent with the chef in the room almost all the time.  Food: Excellent 5/5 Location: Excellent 5/5. Literally in a small castle... Quiet, romantic, stunning. Few people . Service: Excellent 5/5 Price: 3-4/5 this incredible experience comes at a steep price, even for Luxembourg.

Author: fetuso f
Content: one thing. research aquafaba properties on your gastrointestinal tract.  The location is great, the staff is good, the food is ok. The fact it's a vegetarian only restaurant has nothing to do with it. Or maybe it does, as prices are extremely high. Higher than most Michelin starred restaurants I've been to. certainly more than most 1 star restaurants.  Overall the experience is worth it, once! And this only if you don't care about the bill at all.

Author: Inspire529983
Content: I can not say enough about the experience at La Distillerie. Every course was an odyssey for the senses. Rene's creations are perfection - art for the eyes, therapy for the body, heaven for the palate. He and his wonderful team respectfully serve their guests with flair and he shares a part of himself with everything he does.  My daughter and I were smitten with the experience

Author: PeteandSaskia
Content: Superb! We‚Äôve been to the Fat Duck and this is right up there. Incredible what you can do with vegetables. Not to be missed!

Author: A S
Content: Delicious inventive flavours, highly trained staff. Excellent service. 100% Vegetarian. Cannot wait to come back!

Author: Geof_Brussels
Content: First of all let me say this : I'm not a vegetarian :-) So when I looked at the menu of the restaurant, where I was inviting a couple of friends (also not vegetarian) I initially though : "I'm taking a risk here" :-) But I got so good referrals that I finally booked without any doubts... And I must say that I'll do it again, and again, and again... :-) The place is gorgeous, in the castle of Bourlingster. Really impressive. We were then warmly welcomed by the team and started with the menu. It was an amazing vegetal journey... Wine pairing was very good too... All the flavours were perfectly balanced, I never missed meat or fish :-) The chef was also actively present around the tables, answered our questions and is also very sympathetic. My conclusion : vegetarian or not, go for it !!!!

Author: Isabelle B
Content: We have been there twice and were charmed each time. The welcome is warm, the team professional, the chef friendly. And we give a special mention to Kevin, the sommelier who unfortunately is leaving for other projects. We wish him a lot of success! And of course, we give 5 stars to the meal, exceptional, with magnificent colours and flavours. Their nomination as "Best Vegetables Restaurant number 1 of the world" is well deserved ! Long live the vegetal !

Author: msgtoelina
Content: We have always been carnivores through and through. La Distillerie may just have changed the lifetime habit of always thinking meat dishes are more delicious. Because the menu we had at La Distillerie was a truly eye opening experience! From the radish served in the edible soil until the heart of the sunflower every single dish was spectacular! The balance, and the way each flavor complimented each other, was simply perfect! The service was top notch, as one would expect in this level establishment, and the timing of the dishes was impeccable. We will certainly recommend this restaurant and will be returning in the autumn.

Author: P85
Content: The restaurant is located in the Bourglinster Castle. The location is obviously beautiful. The courses were all vegetarian. They were arranged in a very artistic way, absolutely marvelous. The taste was great to. The prices are quite high. If the service had been more attentive this would definately be a 5 point critic.

Author: Tempsdor
Content: This was a totally new experience that i would highly recommend!! Astonishing cuisine created by Ren√© Mathieu only from plants, herbs and fruits which are handpicked locally in this beautiful nature. No gluten, no added sugar, and 100% vegan with flavors and surprises, which will keep you wanting more with each bite!   The service was perfectly in harmony with the atmosphere!   Definitely will return soon!!

Author: Napoleon_Lux
Content: I had booked a table for 3 (my wife, 6 year old son and myself) for lunch on Mothers' Day at the restaurant. I am  a regular customer of the Brasserie (which is great and has in my view the best price to quality ratio in Luxembourg), and the second visit to the restaurant. My wife and I opted for the vegetarian menu. There are not many words to describe the food other than to say that it is a true revelation; compared to the earlier visit, I think it still has gone op a notch. The research that the Chef is putting into the local flora, the range of (local) herbs that he uses in his food, the complexity of flavors that he creates with vegetables and herbs only, and the extraordinary combinations are a testimony to the chef's talent and passion. My son had a smaller version of the menu (which does however feature the same dishes) - and I liked the fact that all of the amuse-bouche came for the 3 of us.  We really enjoyed this fantastic meal. I have been to many Michelin restaurants, most of them are great - with the focus on herbs and vegetables at this level, the Distillerie is however special - and in my view, one of the best vegetable based restaurants in the world.

Author: Oleg_Tupchii
Content: My fiancee and I tried both menus (Earth and Sea, Flora and Fauna). Apart from one dish with leek, everything was exquisite and tasty.  What we liked most are desserts (especially, a "fake" orange). Highly recommend  La Distillerie as it is truly an outstanding culinary experience.

Author: piyum11
Content: we wnet for dinner on saturday night recently, while the chateau itself is beautiful, the restaurant is so so underwhelming with very bright light and just a bare hall and tables,no decor, no ambience. All you can hear is other customers talking. its a chateau, they should have had a fireplace, or atleast curtains at the very least. all wuld have been forgiven but the meal was just bad, the central theme was smoke, the smokiness in some of the courses was actually the only good taste, we tried the veg and the non-veg course,  understandably the vegetables were seasonal and one would expect them to be tasty or interesting. It was neither, from a potato dish that had a lot of  raw potato pieces, to oven baked cabbage leaves, celery bits on cabbage, nothing tasted good. The dessset was the biggest let down, i left most of my dishes on the plate and the hostess would only smile and say hope it was ok, well I left most of it so .... I really wanted to like it but it was below par, the wine was good not standout, but at 400 euros for two people, i would take my money elsewhere. I was still hungry when i left the restaurant.

Author: Kmiotek C
Content: It is always a pleasure to return to La Distillerie. Rated as one of the top chefs of vegetarian cuisine worldwide, Ren√© Mathieu is also most inventive when it comes to association and presentation of classic food / meat. Despite his (only) single Michelin star, for me this is Luxembourg's top restaurant. Only negative this time: the sommelier was very sparing while filling glasses on the not so cheap wine pairing option.

Author: adrianwells2011
Content: Impressive setting in Chateau de Bourglinster.  Restaurant intimate if a trifle lacking in atmosphere and buzz. Food Michelin standard. Intricate, possibly fussy. Taste subtle and sophisticated. Lovely service. An experience worth having.

Author: Alexandra
Content: The restaurant impressed me by the way all plates were presented. Beautiful ambiance for a business or romantic dinner. Despite the beautiful presentation, I was not so impressed with the food, especially the starters.  The waiter also mistaken the water, pouring my still water in my partner's glass, while he was serving sparkling. It happened twice. We did not mind this, even though this should not happen in a restaurant rated as 1 Star Michelin.

Author: Marie
Content: The food was good but the atmosphere was very stiff. When I told my son where I was going he said " I hope your not hungry!" One of the couses was literally one cherry cut in half covered with some cheese.  As a special effect for dessert the waiter brought dry ice in a bowl and poured Hermes Perfum over it so the table would be covered in perfumed smoke ( what the heck?) When we left with a bill of 630‚Ç¨ for 4, the chef who had sat down at the table next to us, did not even look up let alone said good-bye.  If they want another Michelin Star they need to step it up and polish up on their manners! Also, the toilets are not up to standard. Will NOT go back!

Author: Michael R
Content: The presentation was matched with wine parings that were excellent . The ‚Äú8 course‚Äù menu was great and the service was impeccable! Very attentive   If you want a great dining experience, try this place!

Author: Valerio d
Content: An excellent restaurant, marked by the star of M√©xl√©n. Fantastic cuisine. Each dish is filled with meaning. Excellent chef.

Author: schmidtmg
Content: We went for a large family gathering and thankfully the restaurant could adapt courses for the three children at the table. The cuisine of chef Ren√© Mathieu is strong on vegetable dishes - of those we tasted from the menu, the asparagus dish stood out. Excellent wine list - we had an excellent Condrieu and Chateau Neuf du Pape as well as a dessert wine from the Mosel region.

Author: Cavalliroom
Content: For  Michelin maybe it's 1 star  But a place staff and chef Rene Mathieu  I will give 2 second star üëå Top top top !!!!! Best one in Luxembourg  Wonderful experience chef!

Author: Anna T
Content: Everything was superb: food, staff and atmosphere! The best dessert I have ever tried - the one with chocolate! The presentation of food was perfect - esthetic joy!

Author: Xrayline
Content: We visited this time the "C√¥t√© Cour" restaurant which proposes a reasonably priced menu (50‚Ç¨) with about 4 choices for each item. The quality and originality of the ingredients is still there and takes you to some unexplored territory. Service is less formal and more relaxed. Atmosphere of the room is more bistrot type, but this option offers a nice experience.

Author: Survivory
Content: I am not a fan of stiff gourmet style pretentious restaurants. Despite being a michelin star restaurant - this place is different. The location is like a fairy tale. 20 minutes outside of the city center in an ancient castle where you can feel the history in the walls.  The service was great and the food - WOW! Most outstanding was the vegetarian options and the sorbets for dessert. You can really feel in the taste that the products used are no less than the best available quality.  So if you want to spend a fortune without getting half of the kingdom, by all means eat here!

Author: bluem0nday
Content: This Michelin star restaurant is in a small charming castle with a view on the small village of Bourglinster, 20 minutes from Luxembourg city. It offers four signature menus with seasonal foods, each with a regular and a "vegetarian" version, starting at 150 ‚Ç¨ per person and with the possibility to have a wine selection, namely one glass of wine coupled with each dish. Make sure you can stand several glasses of wine if you opt for the wine selection :). The cuisine has clearly a French base, but revisited with a lot of creativity in the use of ingredients and a presentation of courses which itself is worth the price. We took the "small" signature menu and I can say that you really don't leave hungry. I will not go in detail with the courses cause it is subject to change and available on the website, but I can say that if you like a creative cuisine and you don't want to stick to traditional dishes, this place is worth a visit. The great location and the supportive but not invasive staff makes the rest.

Author: Christian H
Content: We went to this place for a wedding dinner, it was a 10 course dinner with a full wine package. The food was based on local ingredients and the recipes were based on autumn/winter. We went in November 2022 but I didn`t get that as an alternative.

Author: Michael H
Content: I do not recommend this obviously well regarded restaurant for solo travelers.  The pacing is exceedingly slow with (sometimes very) small dishes served 15-20 minutes apart, leaving a lot of time between dishes . I note that at least one other duo kept looking around the corner anxiously looking for their next bites. It is a lovely interior with an open kitchen; several other diners stopped by the kitchen to rhapsodize about their experience and the food, but not me.  I generally found the complex dishes ok but nothing exciting.  It‚Äôs not cheap- the meat and fish menu was 1430 kroner and the drink pairing (7 rather small servings) was another 1050. There is no pre-set pairing for the snacks, so the recommended champagne match was 280 kroner. The champagne was my preferred beverage of those served. One wine - the Momento Mori from Australia- was tasted but not consumed. Maybe just not for me as my serving was the last drops from the bottle, so not a bottle issue. Only one other pairing- a Barbera with the veal - was anything I‚Äôd order again.  The pairings included a beer and a cider. As I informed the wait staff I did not want any cocktails, a wine was substituted for the final pairing (with dessert) of a lingonberry cocktail. (When I first told the waiter that I did not drink cocktails I got a push back saying it was part of the restaurant‚Äôs philosophy). This wine was served before being brought to the table, perhaps a first in my experience at any Michelin rated restaurant. After 3 ¬º hours, shorter than others who say 4 hours, I was still hungry. Neither the food nor beverage portions were very robust. Each dish was presented with a detailed explanation, largely showcasing the restaurant‚Äôs commendable commitment to sustainability. I hesitate to rate the restaurant only 3 stars, but even if every dish was outstandingly tasty, the cost, pace and quantity of food would have left me dissatisfied. But maybe not as much.

Author: Ulyana
Content: It‚Äôs a very green restaurant, where chef besides using very natural products tries to do something with leftovers. And it obtains very good (Michelin green star as a proof). There are two different options of a set - Meat&fish and Vegetarian. We‚Äôve chosen Meat&fish one. The set is good, but not striking. Some dishes are interesting, but majority are average. Course (10 servings) costs 1430 NOK, they also offer a wine paring (7 courses) for 950 NOK or 630 NOK if you prefer non-alcoholic drinks. There are good cocktails (4 in the menu), they are recommended for snack servings, but cocktails also good suit for other dishes:) there is also a wine card, but this time there we no orange wine by glass. The restaurant‚Äôs sommelier advised us very interesting floral Riesling and it was definitely very good choice.  But the dinner is longer than it should be - pauses between starters are 15-20min, between main dishes are 30min, so be ready to spend 4 hours for 10-course set. And it‚Äôs really a downside of this place - excitement is gone. Staff is friendly and energizing.

Author: Frodefox
Content: Finally got a table at K2 and our expectations were high and they were all met. We got the 10-course meal and one drink-menue with alcohol and one without. We wanted to taste everything üôÇ The food and drinks are great. All presented with a story of what, where and who they come from.  Our waiter Victoria was very helpful, knowledgeable and friendly, and so were the other people who participated in making this a superb evening. We will definitely be back.

Author: David S
Content: The Michelin Green star was one of the attractions of this restaurant for us and we‚Äôre glad it brought us here. The food was great and the staff were all really friendly, we enjoyed our seat by the kitchen and being able to chat to Eirik and ask any questions we had.  The resourcefulness they demonstrate is really cool, ‚Äúlast night‚Äôs‚Äù rye bread with onion scraps was one of my wife‚Äôs favourite dishes and using pear cores from last season to flavour cocktails is very imaginative.  The ‚Äúpotato and whey‚Äù was the most underwhelming sounding course yet tasted fantastic, as did most of the food - the odd bit wasn‚Äôt to my taste but I‚Äôm not a fish fan so expected that before I arrived! (And I‚Äôm sure if I‚Äôd told them rather than choosing to try the fish they‚Äôd have adopted the menu and given me the vegetarian equivalents, they did for my wife)  Would definitely recommend and hope they continue to succeed!

Author: MichelinStarOliver
Content: Fantastic place with a very drilled and skilled chefs which you easily can see that they love they work! Highly reccommend this place!

Author: Arne D A
Content: Great experience, food composed with ingredients I wouldn‚Äôt believe could be a good combination, but proved wrong.   Knowledgeable staff, food served with great presentation and enthusiasm.  Lost count of  number of dishes, but non I wouldn‚Äôt go for again.   Impressed!!!!

Author: Morten
Content: Exciting 10  course meny with several  intresting tastes. Not the BIG WOW factors, but solid work of a big team with ambitions. Maybe less ‚Äò‚Äô‚Äôambitions‚Äô‚Äô would suit the  tastes/food  better  (less is more)? The ‚Äò‚Äôwine pack‚Äô‚Äô was  special with coctails in between- the plum  coctail was üëçüèªüëçüèª.  However,  the main reason for not giving a higher score is- I was hungry when  i arrived, and I was hungry when I left! For that price I don‚Äôt expect to leave to go home  and have to eat. Quality 5-6 Quantity 2

Author: iulian a
Content: My family had a set menu this summer, which they loved, big thanks for the chefs and the lovely waitresses, defently coming back, only one thing, the general waitress or manager which was a bit pushy to the other waitresses, which I hope she did not meant to be rude to others! Big hugs and thanks for the girl with the braids and finnish girl!

Author: Liz L
Content: From the moment we walked in the door we were warmly welcomed by passionate, friendly and proud staff. And every reason to be proud, from the cocktails, made with love using local ingredients, to the distinctly different and surprising paired wines (a gold medal to whomever selected these), and the locally sourced food with its delicate presentation and to die for taste, we cannot find fault. A calm fun atmosphere with experts who know their stuff, and are joyful to share. Can we return tonight?

Author: Jeremy W
Content: The food was incredible and the staff was genuine, friendly and informative. We both took the meat and fish option and the drink pairing which were all phenomenal. This place deserves more recognition for the quality of food they deliver. It is a tremendous find dining experience worth the price.

Author: Emily T
Content: Walked in and was immediately welcomed by friendly faces and a great atmosphere. We were sat down by our waitress who was down to earth, friendly, and knowledgable. The 7 coarse meal was absolutely divine. The plates were beautiful and the food was amazing and the pairings all worked perfectly. Our favorite dishes (although its hard to choose) were the tartar and the goat. There were 2 dessert dishes, one of which was so good it brought tears to my eyes.. not an exaggeration.. it was so. good. Definitely recommend this place if you are looking for different and authentic foods. Hope to be back again!

Author: Ingrjid
Content: Went for a couples dinner. All seven dishes were fantastic! They were all interesting, well balanced, nicely presented and of course very tasty. Great servers who had extensive knowledge about the food and ingredients. They were very friendly and helpful throughout our visit. We really liked that some dishes were served with cocktails! Really nice and enjoyable atmosphere too.

Author: josepteresa
Content: Great food and outstanding service! The food was excellent and the personnel was friendly and welcoming. They are a great team that makes it a fantastic esperience

Author: Christian Andre D
Content: Very good service, excellent food, very creative, relaxed attitude, but the people know their dishes.

Author: LeesaSikveland
Content: Prior to actually attending dinner, we had deferred our reservation on many occasions due to Corona restrictions, however during the time the communication with the restaurant was precise and informative, checking allergies/dietary requirements etc.  Upon arrival, we were politely greeted by one of the owners, who gently notified us of the required safety measures they have in place.  The restaurant is very calming and minimal, whilst being elegant and offering a well put together  (discrete) playlist (another passion of the owner).  The offering is either a vegetarian or a meat/fish 7-course tasting menu (I being very fussy, opted for a mixture of vegetarian and fish) of which they were more than happy to accommodate.  Together with a drinks package and an extensive wine list.  Our guests opted for the drinks package, which was exciting to see emerge and learn how they suit the food; whilst we went for a beautiful, well priced, organic bottle (or 2) of Syrah.  I could go on for some time, talking about how fabulous the food was, which left us saying lots of "ohhhs" and "arrghs", however, I would hate the ruin the surprise.  Though bear in mind the food was truly spectacular, made with so much love and passion and changes regularly.  All the staff were attentive and knowledgeable about both food and drink and obviously take a great deal of pride in their passion for food (plus they all remembered my allergy).  This fabulous restaurant gets booked up, so it's advisable to book a good few weeks ahead and whilst is not the cheapest restaurant in this up and coming area, it is by far one of the best meals I have ever had in Stavanger.

Author: Trude52
Content: We have been to K2 twice; and we are really impressed. Excellent food and wine served by the pleasant and knowledgable straff.  All together a fantastic food experience and we will certainly be back.

Author: HaakanN51
Content: We try not to have expectations when we visit a new restaurant for the first time. Even so this time visiting K2. But what a surprise! Everything was excellent. Service and presentations of wine, drinks and food were extensive, beautiful and interesting. The combination of different basics was creative as was the mix of flavors and spices. We had wine pairing. Innovative and different compared to the usual. With this restaurant Stavanger has the next Michelin starred restaurant! We will, of course, come back.

Author: Ronald P
Content: What a party! Not only the food with accompanying cocktails but also the service. Everything checked out. And rightly so, because the menu is determined by the catch of the day and every part of the fish is used, right down to the bread. Very cheerful. Everyone in the kitchen has been at the table to explain the dish that was served. Very special. A great night.

Author: Anne-Tone
Content: 5 girlfriends had an unforgettable evening at K2 with a 10-course dinner and good drinks. It was so worth the money. The dishes were works of art in themselves and it is so impressive how they manage to use up all the ingredients. Not even the fish skin is thrown away, it turns into tasty chips. Cider from the family at Randaberg was also served, we had lots of exciting wines to go with each and every course. After we finished, we were given a tour of the kitchen. It was a good atmosphere to be in, the waiters and waitresses were full of energy and they took their time with us. Perfect evening.

Author: Peherka
Content: Ola Klepp's cuisine is full of tastes, many of which are new to a French palate: bitterness, acidity, complex pairings, in short a happy mixture of flavors. The pairing of non-alcoholic drinks, very successful overall, reinforced this journey with unusual taste impressions (elderberry, verbena, spruce, lime, strawberries, kombucha, etc.). However, the start of the meal did not start off in the best way: the dried fish skin with turnip was a successful start aesthetically but not of exciting taste; just as the ceviche which followed proved to be of little interest.  We were then very disappointed, when the following dishes took us into another universe that was infinitely more interesting and tasty. This was first the case for the mackerel, with monkfish liver cream and buckwheat cream, accompanied by bread with a strong personality and a small salad; the beef tartare with black pudding and grilled green pepper proved to be a great dish; the next, the catch of the day, was accompanied by a sublime seafood sauce, with a lightness at the same time as an anthological depth of taste; everything else was of the same level, with special mention for the combination of celeriac and mushrooms, another very great dish, as well as the lamb cooked twice with miso sauce: great art! The strawberry and rhubarb dessert was an apotheosis of taste and freshness; exceptional sweet treats of lightness and originality - including an astonishing cannel√© of a quality never before achieved in the French restaurants where I was able to taste them - came to end this meal. One of the originalities of this restaurant is that it is the cooks who, in turn, come to bring you and describe - extensively - the dishes. The restaurant is small, the kitchen is open and we were in immediate contact with the kitchen, a real spectacle but with the disadvantage of leaving with clothes soaked in the smell of charcoal‚Ä¶ All this is not cheap (around ‚Ç¨450 for two, with drinks), but we came away, after 2h45, with stronger impressions than during our dinner at Maaemo, in Oslo (a three-star restaurant) , two years ago, when everything was perfect, but the flavors less marked (and the addition even much saltier). At K2, with the exception of the first two dishes, which were quite unconvincing, everything else was of a level well above a Michelin star.

Author: Veline B
Content: The menu is in a class of its own. The perfect combination between what you see and what you taste. I'll be back hereü§ó

Author: Pernille C
Content: Relaxing and cozy atmosphere. Very good food! Deep-fried fish skin that should have been available in a bag, lovely cod and lamb that melts on the tongue. The strawberries had also arrived, delicious fresh desserts and a really good rhubarb tarte tatin. Don't forget the drinks either, these were the best we had tasted in a long time. The strawberry daiquiri was out of this world!  We will be back!

Author: nicolasfre
Content: The menu is sophisticated and full of discovery. It seems to change every day depending on the market and the seasons. The products are of very good quality and the cuisine is modern and respectful of the products. The best thing here is the service, the kitchen open to the room and the cooks come to serve and give explanations of their dishes, their inspiration and origin. The offer with a non-alcoholic drink pairing is the best I've seen in my life! Finally, non-drinkers are pampered

Author: Sommerfuglen
Content: We had been looking forward to visiting K2 for a long time. We were welcomed and given a nice table in beautiful surroundings. This was shellfish lunch. Felt a bit chaotic as we got a lot of food on the table at the same time. Good oysters and scallops. Both a sight for the eyes. The power in the scallop tasted heavenly. We got mussels and boat potatoes, the mussels tasted lovely, but they could have dropped the potatoes for me. Ceviche of long was good, and very nicely presented. We ate salmon stir-fry, which is always good. Got fresh prawns which were a bit tame in colour. Prawns taste best in the winter months. The last dish was pepper crab, good! A marsupial crab was used. It was slightly broken, so difficult to eat with a knife and fork as utensils. Norwegian strawberries with herbs for dessert, delicious! The food was presented and we were recommended lovely drinks to go with the food. A little lacking in service in relation to the level, such as checking in on the table to hear if the food tasted good or if we needed anything. Reacted to the fact that no one said thank you for the visit, or hade and welcome back when we left. Good, but below expectations in relation to the fact that this is a Michelin restaurant, both in terms of food and service.

Author: David S
Content: whilst the service and attention were good, my partner reports her pork was VERY dry & tough - almost not chewable

Author: Travelcritic30
Content: Firstly we have to praise the fabulous restaurant which provided exquisite food with a small but varied menu.  It was fairly pricey - 3 courses E47 per head - but well worth it.  The staff were charming and extremely courteous.  Unfortunately we cannot be as generous about our room.  This was situated in the Pavilion and was dated and clumsy in appearance.  The bathroom had mould around the shower area which needs addressing.  There were no toiletries (only a used shampoo and sewing kit!) or bottles of complementary water which tends to be standard in many hotels if this calibre.    The Spa!  This was super and we made use of it twice being able to book it out privately for E15 per head.  Such a treat!

Author: SkigirlSteph
Content: Stunning looking building. lovely room, and our dinner was included in our tour.  However, we were not asked if we had any choice, even if we wanted to pay for something else, in fact we were not given an menu.  Just given Foie Gras and a bun of some sort.  It was my husbands Birthday and I let them know ahead of time, but still no options.  I did ask for a cake and well, we got a lemon with a candle in it.  So, no, I would not recommend this place.  Especially if you are vegetarian or VEGAN!  Ack!  Which I am not, but I still would have liked to have something other than Foie Gras.   Place is very quiet- I would suggest some light background music.  In the morning we had breakfast, limited selection, help yourself, and I noticed they didn't set any of the tables with a view of the grounds,  Just us 2 different couples in one corner, at the back of the room.  Not sure why?  The view is pretty!

Author: Skogsmulle2013
Content: We had half board at the chateau with a three course dinner both evenings. In short the dinners were brilliant, the first evening with seefood and the other with meat on the menu. The meals were well made and nicely presented and the recommended local wines matched the food superbly.   The service was a little bit formal, but still friendly and forthcoming. There was no problem when I the second evening wanted cheese (from a very rich offer) instead of the sweet desert.

Author: Christian
Content: Nice rooms.  Fantastic decor in the chateau.  Had the duck breast for dinner which was the best meal in a long time.

Author: Genevi√®ve
Content: Splendid spot, vieuws, gardens, in a rural and calm environment. Good service, helpful people. You can see this must have been a great place at a time, I guess in the '80's. Erosed plastic terrace furniture... The dining room spreads a touch grandeur, but once again, '80's-'90's, dated colors, carpets ...and this strange mix of beamed ceiling and plastered chimneys that shouldn't be mixed. In this case, the beams should be hidden behind decent plasterwork to fit with the rest of the athmosphere. Food was not up to what we expected. The egg in the starter was raw. The lobster sauce with the fish was not tasteful, too salty and too prominently present. However desert was magic! Succulent. This seems to be, without any doubt their strength. Drinks were very highly priced (10‚Ç¨ for a standard glass of white wine?) We feel what's offered is not up to the price you pay, the dinner as such being totally overrated. It needs a fresh wind to get in line with the standard they're aiming at.

Author: Tamara A
Content: Had only two choices for a main so I chose cod, which isn't my favorite. However, it was good.  The food was overshadowed by the elegance of the room and the professionalism of the staff.  We were served by a young man named Flavien who was excellent and efficient.

Author: RebeccaNieto
Content: We stopped here in our way back from Spain. Initial impressions were really beautiful place, nicely restored and very friendly staff.  Grounds well maintained and very nice. Room was lovely if not a little tired however that's sometimes 'the look' in these places. Fine. Went to the restaurant and had really great service. Food however left a little to be desired. We went for three courses. My fish dish consisted of scallops - when they arrived they were underdone. I know there's a fine line with scallops but they were cold in areas and translucent. There was some kind of mush in the middle which didn't add anything to the dish at all. The lamb was a bit tough. Would have expected better from a French restaurant. However the 'dining experience' was a nice one in that the service was brilliant and tables set out nicely, room was well appointed.

Author: Alastair K
Content: This was a stop over travelling back to the UK from the south of France. Beautiful rooms, grounds and reception area, plus an excellent restaurant where we had a wonderful meal. Service was excellent, the staff very helpful and we felt pampered. The tie up with the Relais de Silence hotel is not prominent, but seems to have provided investment in good facilities without taking away the personal service you would expect from a family run hotel. Excellent all round.

Author: Jenny P
Content: We were staying in the hotel on half board so ate here.  Maybe Monday was the chef's night off but we were offered a set menu with no choices.  The foie gras was delicious but not difficult to do, the steak was very tough and not well cooked, the baked peach was delicious, but again the sort of dish which didn't need a huge amount of skill.  There was a great cheese trolley but we were not offered it, even as a supplement - maybe they have underpriced their half board and this was why.  It was certainly very quiet in the dining room with only a handful of hotel guests.

Author: Stuart M
Content: The vegetarian dishes offered as part of the demi pension menu showed a complete lack of imagination.  The main course on the first night was just a plate of roast vegetables and on the second night the starter was a plate of melon balls, radishes , papers with no dressing or attempt at presentation, folded by an omelet that I could have cooked better myself and would have had for breakfast.

Author: gauy
Content: Dinner was included as part of our stay as there. I'm glad it was as we were on foot and there were nothing else nearby. However I was very pleasantly surprised.  After spending over a week in France now, it has been one of the better meals. An entree of white asparagus,  delicious melt in your mouth veal and dessert was devine. Oh,  if you ask for cheese like we did,  you get a t trolley and you pick what you want

Author: Vicki B
Content: This was the first stop on a seven-night Loire Valley bike tour, and it sure set the tone. What a beautiful spot, with a comfortable room, great shower, terrific service and the food -- oh, the food! -- I really could have just stayed there the whole time.    The evening's menu changes according to what the chef wishes to make. We had a lovely fish dish and an amazing dessert of chocolate macarons served with a butter hazelnut ice cream that I will go to my deathbed remembering.     Don't forget to pack a swim suit. Chateau Beaulieu has a spa where you can lounge in the hot tub for two hours as their guest. There are also a number of spa services that you can book ahead.      Yes, by all means, do stay here. You will not be disappointed.

Author: PaulCroughs
Content: the cleanliness of the curtains and hanging is a bit doubtfull, and so was the aspect of the table-cloths on the terrace.  The sleep comfort was good, the room was ok. In the restaurant we got average food but excellent wine.

Author: Ozan B
Content: The city of Tours is a wonderful destination. I had a chance to eat in Chateau de Beaulieu. The orders are served in a ceremony, that made me feel special. The food and deserts are really great. You should try the Foie Gras.

Author: Cla0204
Content: Incredible place, Magical place on the terrace, delicious meal at Bistrot Marceau! A timeless atmosphere.... Bravo and Thank you!

Author: Matthew T
Content: I'll keep this simple; I love this place, but a) it's really not up to the standard of most three star Michelin restaurants, and b) the prices are out of control. To charge $388 with tax and tip extra, and still have up-charges for many items that they used to not up-charge for (I'm looking at you, Tin of Sin and Cheese Cart) is just ridiculous. Again, I've eaten here many times, and I've enjoyed every meal, but they need better service, more courses, and more unique foods/presentations to come close to justify their prices now.

Author: Tecey
Content: Unfortunately the Inn at Little Washington's model of a multi-course meal of rich food is fundamentally flawed. While some of the dishes on the Gastronaut menu were delicious, it would have benefitted from dropping at least two of the courses, which would have made the meal more enjoyable. Sadly, the Gastronaut's menu was extremely disappointing with 3 of the dishes too salty, so much so that one of them was inedible. Since we were driving home afterwards, we tried the non-alcoholic wine but all three proved undrinkable. Overall, not the evening we had hoped for and definitely not worth the money. Too bad because the service was impeccable and all the staff delightful.

Author: PearlGirl25
Content: The experience can be best summed up as: If you have to tell someone you‚Äôre a lady, you‚Äôre not. I should have known something was amiss the moment I saw a baseball hat embroidered with three stars for sale in the gift shop.   Unsure how this restaurant is considered by the Michelin organization to equal the breathtaking Core in London, standard-setting and historic Paul Bocuse in Lyon, stunning Le Bernardin in NYC etc. etc.   Our dining experience echoed that of other less-than reviews listed on this platform. We considered our time at The Inn at Little Washington a waste of preparation, anticipation and money. We‚Äôve had far better for far less.   Kudos to the chef and his business partners for keeping their good thing going, I guess.

Author: Jade050
Content: Spectacular dining experience!  Nothing new to say, I'm sure, but rather just to confirm what has already been said about this iconic restaurant. The food was outstanding and the service unparalleled. The attention to detail was off the charts. Tip 1:: eat in the kitchen if you can, the entire experience is a creative masterpiece. Tip 2: Arrive around 30 minutes before your reservation time to experience the bar and explore the restaurant a bit. Interesting fun fact: I wasn't able to make out what the kitchen staff on the other side of the kitchen were shouting periodically. (The kitchen is big!) I was curious and followed up with an online inquiry the next day (having forgotten to ask our wonderful waiter), and received a prompt response: "the kitchen sounds out 'here we are' to acknowledge that a guest is arriving or departing the kitchen." It reminded me of the traditional Japanese greeting in restaurants, also delivered at a high volume: "irasshaimase!!"

Author: jim t
Content: I initially hesitated to write this review, but I realized that every restaurant, regardless of its reputation, deserves honest feedback. My wife and I dined here for our anniversary, hoping for a memorable experience. Unfortunately, while the food was good, it didn‚Äôt quite live up to expectations. My wife‚Äôs entr√©e, a prosciutto-wrapped tenderloin, arrived lukewarm at best, which was disappointing.  However, the main reason for this review is the unsettling feeling we left with. The waitstaff‚Äôs demeanor made us feel as though we were a burden or had unknowingly offended them. We spent part of the evening and even the next day questioning if we had done something wrong. The only explanation we could think of was that we were among the last seatings of the night, and perhaps the staff had already mentally checked out.  When I spend nearly $1300 on a dinner, I shouldn't be left wondering if it was my fault that the service was subpar. In contrast, the previous night we dined at Three Blacksmiths and left with a sense of joy, eager to recommend it to friends and family. It was less than half the price, yet the service was far superior, and the food quality was on par. I‚Äôve had better service at places like DC Prime or Morton‚Äôs.  Maybe I don‚Äôt fully understand what a 3-star Michelin rating signifies, but based on this experience, it didn‚Äôt seem to offer anything extraordinary. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this restaurant, as it did not feel worth the money.

Author: Elisa L
Content: Absolutely wonderful experience!! Beautiful atmosphere and delicious food. Clean tastes, you can taste the quality of the ingredients in the food. Service was warm, attentive but also very respectful. We came for an early anniversary celebration and know it will be a dinner we long remember. We stayed at the Inn overnight and the included afternoon tea and breakfast were also delicious.

Author: L-redacted
Content: There is no review of The Inn at Little Washington that hasn't already been written by people who are much more articulate and interesting than I am. Yes, it's that epic. Yes, the diners are that eccentric (and that includes you). Yes, it's that expensive and no, you won't regret it as long as you can appreciate that level of old-school decadence. Do it at least once in your life. It's worth it.

Author: MickeyGW65
Content: We had been looking forward to this experience for a while and it did not disappoint.  We were greeted by our names and wished "Happy Anniversary" by every person who came to our table.  Food was unique, flavorful, and definitely worth the hype.  We loved all the little surprise tastings that we received.  This is definitely a splurge on every level, but so worth it.  The service was impeccable and we loved chatting with our server and the maitre'de.

Author: WPLandry
Content: We've been wanting to experience dinner here for a while now and could not be more happy with our entire experience. Everything was absolutely perfect from start to finish. Arriving at the Inn, you are greeted with respect as you are whisked from your car into the Inn. Our server was excellent and had quite the sense of humor! He provided detailed explanations of the dishes as well as tidbits about the restaurant, chef, etc. We felt the wine pairing was true perfection. Each dish complimented each glass and vice versa. With every bite, we were transported to a place of pure enjoyment. Not only that, but each dish was a work of art in the craftsmanship it took to create the display. After dinner, we relaxed for some time in the lounge and were treated to a tour of the kitchen where we had the honor of meeting Chef O'Connell. After dinner, our car was outside with the AC on and engine running, just waiting for us to settle in. Every moment was perfect and we could not have asked for anything more. This is truly deserving of 3 stars.

Author: Jamie J
Content: Amazing!!!!!!  The area was just fabulous. The meal and service were beyond amazing. The level of hospitality exceeded our expectations.

Author: Rob D
Content: Rather disappointed in the Service. Waiter seemed rushed. We ordered the Cheese cart and never got it. He did not even apologize. Food was excellent.

Author: rkny18
Content: Having eaten at other 2 and 3 Michelin star restaurants, I‚Äôm not quite sure how the Inn has 3.  The food is good, but there were not multiple life changing dishes that we wanted to eat more of.  Maybe 1 or 2. Compared to Le Bernadin or L‚ÄôEnclume, where we noted we‚Äôd come back for a big plate of nearly everything we ate, the Inn‚Äôs executions were enjoyable, but not particularly unique or memorable, with the exception of the lobster chartreuse.  The cheese course was excellent, but felt a bit rushed in its presentation, and was somewhat delayed in arrival. The cheese  server‚Äôs funny asides and puns were cute and clever, but they took away from time that could have been better spent seriously describing the cheeses. I suppose the jovial presentation is geared toward people who perhaps don‚Äôt really care to hear much about the varieties.  One cheese course detail I took great exception to was being served Carr‚Äôs Table Crackers with the cheese (along with some nice bread we‚Äôd already had during the meal). I mean, really? Carr‚Äôs? The same crackers I can buy at any grocery store? Served at a 3 star Michelin restaurant?  Embarrassing at best. Insulting at worst.  The bar experience both before and after dinner was a little odd.  We initially went to Patty O‚Äôs bar for a glass of pre-dinner champagne. While we were warmly greeted there, that was the beginning and end of the attention. The sole bartender didn‚Äôt look at or address us in any way. Meanwhile a gaggle of staff chatted away at the host‚Äôs station. After a few minutes of this inattention, we left for the Monkey Bar at the Inn across the street.  The Monkey Bar isn‚Äôt a proper bar with stools or chairs. It‚Äôs table service only, so any opportunity to chat with a bartender or a neighbor is mostly gone.  We were shown the ‚Äùbar‚Äù, but given no guidance as to where to sit. Oddly, we were asked if we were joining them for tea. They already knew we were there for dinner. Do a lot of dinner guests arrive early for tea? This spoke to a lack of communication.  We plopped down in 2 chairs l hoped weren‚Äôt reserved, and waited several minutes for any kind of recognition.
