Finally, someone came by to wipe down our table, which in my mind should have been done immediately after the previous guest left, not as we sat there watching.  A server came by to take a water order and chatted with us briefly about the whisky offerings. But after he left, he was replaced by s different server and we never interacted with him again.  This proved to be somewhat thematic throughout dinner. We were told we had one main server, and we did see her a few times, but it felt like each course was served by someone different, with varying levels of knowledge, polish, and enthusiasm.  One server kicked our table. Another bumped abruptly into my wife‚Äôs arm with no apology. So much for those ballet lessons Patrick paid for for the staff!  We asked for sparkling water. A random server brought it. I didn‚Äôt recognize the label so I enthusiastically asked ‚ÄúOh, what‚Äôs that?‚Äù, pointing to the label. ‚ÄúSparkling water‚Äù replied the server. lol come on. She eventually grasped that I was asking where it was from.  After the meal, we sensed they wanted the table back, so we decided to get after dinner drinks back at the bar.  Again, no actual bar, just some cushy chairs. It was comfortable, but my wife was a bit chilly from the AC blowing on her legs.  I asked our bar server if they had a throw she could use. He replied ‚ÄúOf course‚Äù, which has maddeningly become the de facto reply from the younger generation of servers today, to every request, regardless of the sincerity of the responder or the response.  No throw ever materialized. My wife remained chilly.  More chilly than the air however, were the drink prices.  $200 for a 1 ounce pour of an unusual but certainly not rare Islay Scotch, an entire bottle of which can be purchased for $250. $51 for a 1 ounce pour of basic Laphroaig 10 year. A bottle of that is $60 most places. Champagne by the glass prices were similarly silly.   I guess the alcohol prices were designed to keep people from lingering after the meal, and to make the $170 wine pairing seem like a bargain.   The wine pairing was fantastic I should add. And our sommelier, Nicole, was easily the most attentive, knowledgeable, and enthusiastic server we encountered the entire evening. The perfect mix of personable and professional.  Had more of the staff been as great at what they do as Nicole is, I could see 3 Michelin stars. As it is, much of the staff seemed like college kids on summer break.  There is much talk of Mr. O‚ÄôConnell expanding the Inn. Until he can shore up the service (and push the food envelope a bit) as it stands, I think he risks losing a star or two by becoming even larger. It‚Äôs clearly already a challenge for Mr. O‚ÄôConnell to find experienced knowledgeable staff in the middle of the Virginia countryside. I don‚Äôt see how expanding his operation begets better service.

Author: mattva1
Content: What was supposed to be a fantastic evening, turned into a nightmare.   It started a few hours before our dinner when they called and asked me if I would move our reservation up an hour because they had some last-minute cancellations. I figured maybe they had some VIPs or something and wanted my slot. I didn‚Äôt really care so I agreed, but clearly explained that I wanted to have a drink before dinner in their bar area. She understood and agreed, saying that a lot of guests do that.  So I thought all was good. It wasn't.  I show up on time and am greeted with ‚Äúyour table is ready.‚Äù I asked to have ten minutes for a drink at the bar, but the receptionist wasn't having it. after explaining that we had discussed it when they asked to move my reservation up, she agreed but gave me a disgusted and snarky ‚Äúfine, let us know when you are ready‚Äù sendoff.    So, I am left in a horrible confrontation situation which I didn‚Äôt ask for. But, now it is awkward, people think I‚Äôm being difficult, they are mad, etc. In any other situation I would have asked my wife if it was ok to leave and find another spot  ‚Äì but they make you pre-pay a small fortune, it‚Äôs our anniversary, there is nowhere else to go in the town, and we drove hours to get there ‚Äì so I was stuck, there was nothing I could do.   I‚Äôm so disappointed because all I wanted was a few minutes to enjoy a high-end, caringly made Manhattan before dinner. I'm sure it sounds small, but I was truly looking forward to it because I only drink on special occasions due to a health scare. Unfortunately for me, that moment was ruined. There was no way I could enjoy myself so I gave up, and couldn't get out of the bar to our table fast enough. But the whole negative vibe carried over into dinner ‚Äì where I felt rushed and unsettled. My wife knew I was upset and did her best. But, the entire dinner, meal, experience sucked. I hated every minute of it.   I‚Äôm sure everyone else will rave about the place. And I get it, having been there half-dozen times for dinners, fundraisers, special occasions - so I do appreciate it. But, that is gone.   No way should this have happened ‚Äì especially at a place where it costs $1,200 for dinner for two.   As far as the food went, it could have been the best meal in the world and it wouldn‚Äôt have mattered to me under the circumstances. But, it wasn‚Äôt even particularly good. They killed the shrimp and duck with dill. Except for some egg thing (which was great) the rest was just ok.   While I‚Äôm at it, one thing that surprised me was that the mens room was a bit gross. I expect that at an airport or some public place. But, not at a restaurant like this. In all fairness, it‚Äôs not entirely their fault if someone can‚Äôt hit the urinal, and I noticed someone was heading that way to clean things up. But, it‚Äôs a bad look for sure.

Author: Eleanor S
Content: Wonderful food, impeccable service, but they do not have a handicapped toilet. I am handicapped, and I could not get up from the toilet, which was 12 or 13 inches from the ground. Aren't they supposed to comply with the ADA?

Author: UE_DC64
Content: We stayed one night at the Inn and enjoyed the afternoon tea, the dinner, and the breakfast. What stood out to me was how pampered I felt. There were more staff taking care of us than there were customers. The lodging was super cute and had everything one could wish for, and with small, nice gifts in several rounds. Of course, it wasn't cheap.   The dinner was exquisite but with a few things that could have been better. I loved everything I ate, and the dishes were nicely (and sometimes innovatively) presented. But, while the menu left my wife full, I finished the meal feeling I had room for more. And I am not super huge or anything. We seem to have been unlucky with the bread service. We didn't get any bread (other tables did) and when I asked if we could also get some bread, the response was "Yes, I can get you some bread", as if I were asking for a side order, rather than a response like "Oh, sorry, we missed you, we will get you bread right away". And I had to do it again for a second piece of bread. This is  very unusual for any good restaurant. Perhaps I was unlucky.  I was also a little disappointed with the breakfast. We got a very nice parfait of sort and then a basket with different types of mostly sweet stuff. Anything else, like an omelet or such would cost an extra $25--rather outrageous in my view. I had expected a nice buffet with lots of different types of bread, cheeses, yogurts, etc., as I would get in any hight star hotel.  All in all, we had a great stay here and enjoyed the pampering and the excellent food, but I few things did not live up to my expectations (for the price we paid)

Author: WildTravelMan17
Content: An absolutely incredible experience. Each course of the meal was an absolutely unexpected delight  that tasted both unique and familiar. The Chartreuse of Cabbage and Lobster, Lamb pair with Ch√¢teauneuf-du-Pape, and caviar dishes were of particular note.   The wait staff was also incredible. I had delightful conversations with the sommelier on duty that night, multiple servers, and enjoyed the milk-related puns of the cheese cart guy.   Patrick O‚ÄôConnell came out to meet me and we chatted about the wildfires back home. I was even given a tour of the kitchens.

Author: Lady Jenese Mim... F
Content: The service is beyond compare and the waitstaff makes you feel you are the only one there. The food is imaginative fresh and pure. The ambiance is like dinner with royalty. It is my favourite place for celebrating your anniversary.

Author: Shubha S
Content: We had amazing dinner here to celebrate our 40 th wedding anniversary and we thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Service was out of this world. Food was delicious and presented with great artistic flair. It seemed like we were eating for 2 hours; but food was very light and did not weigh us down. All in all, very memorable experience

Author: sarah w
Content: I do not understand the negative reviews.  If you are complaining about the cost, then this is not a culinary experience for you.  If you are complaining about the portions, then I do not know what to say, but I was more than full and I did not consume everything they offered to me.   My boyfriend and I booked the kitchen table for a birthday celebration.   We were immediately greeted and ushered to the living room of the Inn where we enjoyed some cocktails before dinner.  Then we were greeted by one of the hosts and ushered into the kitchen itself for dinner after being told that we had our table for the entire evening and should not feel rushed, but encourage to tarry and enjoy.    When we entered the kitchen there was an enjoyable exhibition of pomp and circumstance as we were personally greeted by Chef Patrick O'Connell by name and his brilliant smile.  Our table was spacious and the seating comfortable.  Immediately the attentive staff began to serve and accommodate us.  Everyone was gracious and enjoyable.  We had water immediately and personalized menus in hand as we were guided through the selections and choices before us.  With those made, we began an incredible experience for any passionate foodie.    Everything from the house made bread and butter to the parmesan truffle popcorn was not only delicious, but available for unlimited refills.  Restraint was necessary to avoid being overly full long before the end of the meal.  We chose to get everything on the gastronaut's menu between the two of us, including the $62.00 upcharge for the caviar dish.  We had ten courses, including a hand delivered first dessert course by Patrick in honor of the birthday.  Every course and thus every dish was exceptional in taste and presentation.  They then sent us home with a bespoke box of confections.  We got more than I expected.    We also chose to do the wine pairing, and with that additional charge, I can say that one should expect to spend several thousand dollars for an all in dining experience in the chef's kitchen.  What you pay for is an experience and an encounter with not just the 3 Star Michelin Chef himself, but his staff and to witness first hand the amazing fluidity of the kitchen staff.  While I have never eaten in the dining room, I can say that I would without hesitation come back and dine there.  This was a once in a lifetime experience to mark a special occasion for us, so the expense was well worth it to us,  but if you are concerned about the fiscal bottom line or portion size, then this might now be the culinary experience for you.  For us, it was one to remember forever.

Author: Jose G
Content: My meal was included with the stay at the hotel. Dinner, service and location were excellent, well deserved 3 Michelin Stars. The only issue we had was that during our arrival the person at the front desk ask for prove of the reservation. I did not have cell signal and could not show her. She made me and my wife very uncomfortable. I would expect that an hotel that is so highly regarded would have better service at their reception. After I gave her my Id and told her to check she found my reservation. She should have asked for an ID before she asked for proof of reservation. If you are white they probably won't have any issues finding your reservation.  Overall, after this small incident, everything was perfect and the stay was memorable. Breakfast at the hotel was also excellent and service during breakfast was great.

Author: Raksmie H
Content: I‚Äôm giving this restaurant a 2-stars ‚Äî I‚Äôve dined at over 15 Michelin star restaurants all over the world and 3 of the 15 were 3-stars so I‚Äôd like to think that I‚Äôm pretty experienced.  I really wanted to walk into this experience loving it but it was average, over priced, and underwhelming (just like I stated in my title).   Staff: Very friendly and super nice, they greeted us at the door and walked us to our table (as expected).  The service at the table was a miss for me, they left crumbs on our table from the bread and it was never cleaned up, usually you‚Äôll have people who come around and clean your crumbs. There wasn‚Äôt a stool or a basket where you can put your purse or belongings in, usually they have that at the the table. The sommelier wasn‚Äôt certified but he was the sweetest kid! I could tell he was still in training due to his lack of knowledge of pairing the wine with the food, and I also learned that he tried deconstructed dishes that are usually left overs to help him pair the wine which I find very interesting because if you want consistency  throughout the experience, every sommelier should be treated the same. I understand that he‚Äôs in training but why wouldn‚Äôt you have a certified sommelier around to assist him. The condensation from the wine dripped over my fianc√© bread as it was being poured, I‚Äôm used a clean bottle. Overall the staff was nice and knowledgeable.   Food: The food was so good but it wasn‚Äôt great. We picked the Gastronomy menu with the wine pairing. I found it odd that with the menu you still had to pick this or that, I‚Äôm used to enjoying everything on the menu as is but if we still need to pick between appetizers, main course, and dessert let‚Äôs not call it a tasting menu. The food was cooked and well prepared but the plating was boring and subpar, there was no theme to the menu it was just food on a white plate.  None of the dishes wowed me it was just good. The wine paired well with the food but we didn‚Äôt get the background of what notes to taste for or look forward to, I didn‚Äôt enjoy the 4 empty glasses placed on the table for future wine to come, it over crowded our table and it made it a little complicating for our server to serve us food as things had to be moved around ‚Äî not the type of service you would expect from a 3-star.   Parking: Plenty of parking and valet available. Ambiance: Beautiful seating area and nice colonial feel.  Vegetarian and‚Äôs vegan options available.  Overall Summary: In short, you don‚Äôt get what you pay for. I suggest you save up the $2K you‚Äôre about to spend on this experience and purchase a plane ticket overseas and pay for a 3-star in Spain or France.

Author: Kendall K
Content: This restaurant is good but overhyped. I think Michelin gives this one a ‚Äúpass‚Äù due to the uniqueness of its location, the history and frankly it needs to be re-rated because it does not meet the standard of a Michelin 3 star like Aponiente in Spain. I had high expectations due to how everyone in the town speaks so highly of this place. It honestly feels a little weird because it‚Äôs as if everyone is afraid to speak truthfully on the restaurant out of fear they‚Äôll disappear like in a horror movie, kind of cultish vibes. If this is your first Michelin I get why you‚Äôd love this place but they have some work to do.   Anyway, out of all of the Michelin restaurants I‚Äôve been to, the service, the presentation and the food all was top notch and was like a dance. The Inn at Little Washington seemed like they were resting on the fact that they were a top rated restaurant and didn‚Äôt need to work as hard. For a restaurant that I spent nearly $1,600 for I expected a lot.   I didn‚Äôt like that I had to pick between menus. Since I paid for a tasting menu with a wine pairing I expected the restaurant to provide several courses that would fill me up and I was not anywhere near full at the conclusion of dinner. The plating and presentation of the food was boring, there was no style or awe factor in how the food was presented. Most places will try to match the cuisine to a creative plate. It was pretty underwhelming. The Michelin company rated The Inn to have a gastronomy star yet the restaurant didn‚Äôt explain what specifically about their menu was gastronomy like others that I‚Äôve been too.   The sommelier we had wasn‚Äôt certified and didn‚Äôt have his grape pin. Typically Michelin restaurants who have a sommelier in training will have an actual sommelier with them throughout the dining experience. With our wine pairing they placed several empty glasses on the table which I had never seen before and didn‚Äôt fill them, typically your wine glasses aren‚Äôt just sitting on the table taking up space from your plates. Generally each glass is brought to you for each course. They didn‚Äôt take the time to wipe off the bottles after they pulled it from the wine cooler, as the sommelier in training poured, there was lots of ice water from the bottle dripping on our table and food.   The waiters didn‚Äôt remove bread crumbs from our table, didn‚Äôt fold our napkins when we went to the restroom, didn‚Äôt have a stool or basket for us to put our belongings in at our table. Nothing during the fine dining screamed three star restaurant, I think Michelin needs to re-evaluate this, I believe this place is a ONE star at best. Overseas Michelin‚Äôs seem to have to go through a higher grading criteria because I‚Äôve seen way better places that are underrated that could be two or three stars and the Inn is somehow rated higher with not nearly as good of service.   Typically if the chef is not on travel they will come out and greet their guest and Mr. O‚ÄôConnell didn‚Äôt seem to have the time I presume to stop by tables to simply say hello. I truly expected more but you know what they say about high expectations leading to high disappointment. It‚Äôs just not worth the money spent.

Author: SVWOnline
Content: Not our first visit, but certainly our least enjoyable.  Our only expectation was that the experience would justify the $2800 we paid for a party of 4. I feel strongly that objectively it missed the mark. I will repeat what others reviewers have already stated. My very first cocktail was incorrect. The food service timing was oddly off. A table close to us was seated after we were and was on their 3rd course before our appetizers arrived. The bread service was inconsistent and as many have pointed out the breadcrumbs on our table were only removed prior to our desert. Quarters were cramped, forcing servers to reach over the table. Multiple times during the meal objects were dropped close by startling all of us. Overall the service was good but not delivered with ease and the engagements felt rehearsed. The star of the evening was our sommelier. Her knowledge and explanations of our wine pairings were both insightful and entertaining. At the end of our meal we were not offered after dinner drinks or coffee/tea service. We end up retiring to the bar area for drinks, where the disappointment continued and we waited 15 minutes for someone to recognize we were done so we could pay our check. I ended up paying cash for the drinks so we could leave without any further hurdles. It‚Äôs unfortunate and I don‚Äôt think we‚Äôll be back.

Author: Joan A
Content: This dinner lived up to every expectation.  What a great night!  The food was out of this world.  I don‚Äôt think I can pick a favorite. My husband and I celebrated our 35th anniversary here. Cameron the cheese whiz entertained us but also put together a terrific cheese selection for us.    The inn sent us home with some very tasty treats as well.  Will do this again for sure.  Also, seeing the kitchen in action from the window was spectacular.

Author: vivianm637
Content: This restaurant definately deserve *** Michilin Star.  The course, the wine, the atmosphere is to the core.  I would love to be back again

Author: emilija d
Content: Waited 25 min at a table outside, nobody came... They weren't busy, there were only 2 person at the next table... so I presume they just don't care..

Author: HofH999
Content: This is a wonderful old characterful hotel right in the centre of town. Try to get room 10 for a spacious room with TWO bathrooms. Restaurant is brilliant. Breakfast is also outstanding. Fabulous

Author: Janez P
Content: A Wonderful experiece from local cusine. The food is good and colorfu, and the emphasis is mainly on home made dishes.Special praise to "Gorenjska breakfast". We would also like to praise the knowledge and friendlines of the waiter, who knew how to describe the food appropriately and was also witty. We highly recommend the restaurant. Alenka in Janez

Author: Natasa J
Content: Amazing food, ambient and service! I highly appreciate their effort to include local ingredients, small slovene family manufacturers and traditinal slovene recipes.  We are family of four (two teenagers) and we loved it. We had delicious and healthy lunch (three courses) that we completed in less than 2 hours.  We recommend the trip to Radovljica and join the visit to Linhart hause with the workshop at  Radol‚Äôca Chocolate (few steps away) or with one of museums or just walk through beautiful old town.

Author: CAGrapeGrower
Content: Excellent, local food.  Great staff. Good recommendations on wine. Deserves Michelin recommendation.  Would return.

Author: Judy B
Content: This restaurant uses fresh local ingredients. We  had a 3 course dinner with their wine. It was amazing. We went with a group and everyone was raving how wonderful it was. The chocolate dessert with strawberries had hot fudge poured over it that melted the hollow ball of chocolate. The flavor was addicting! Service  was excellent and they explained each course. They are proud of their restaurant and should be. I am hard to impress when it comes to food and this was great.It is located in a renovated but preserved home built in the 1400s in a small attractive village near Lake Bled.

Author: Michael Podt
Content: We enjoyed a fabulous lunch here. We splurged on the 9-course option with wine airing and it did not disappoint. Beautiful dishes and delicious wines. We very much enjoyed the casual atmosphere, there is no fancy vibe here. We sat on the terrace which was super nice. As lunch took about 4 hours, we were happy with all the distractions the lovely square offered.

Author: Vierdank
Content: The little town Radovljica is near to the tourist village Bled and has a beautiful fairy tale old town part. On the main street - in a likewise charming and beautifully renovated house - you'll find Hisa Linhardt. It is primarily a gorgeous restaurant with an "attached" hotel.  The old and renovated - simple yet elegant - house (and yes, hisa means house) have some hotel room individually decorated and of different sizes. After the dinner it is rather nice to take ten steps to your bed, so consider an overnight stay.  Ten steps... indeed. There are a number of rooms for dining spread out all over the house. So, for instance, our party of four were seated on the landing of the first floor. Even after quite a dose of champagne it will be hard not to find the way home...  Ambition in the kitchen is high and so is the skill. Clever flavour compositions with both traditional cooking and surprises charactherizes the menu. Wich can be had as 5, 7 or 9 courses. For what Hisa Linhardt can deliver, the prizes are moderate and affordable for an experience of this kind. Present prizes (August -23) are 89, 109 and 129 EUR respectively.  We had the 5 course and with one amuse bouche coming in after another we ended up with around 10 servings.  We took the wine pairing to see what the sommelier felt was right to the different courses. He was mostly spot on - with some few drawbacks. On the other hand much is of course about personal taste.  Amongst all that was being served we felt that the vegetable dishes really shined. Also when shellfish was presented, we admired the knowledge in the kitchen how to treat really fine ingredients without drowning them in other flavours.  On the whole a wonderful evening and the Michelin star is definitely well deserved!  Highly recommended!

Author: richard Sigel
Content: Michelin star at reasonable price (but not cheap). Excellent service. Several prix fixe menus. Food very good but I wish Michelin star restaurants were not so precious, too much foam with the food. That has become a cliche. Nevertheless excellent food of highest quality. Most things from local farms. Excellent wine list.

Author: cktraveller40
Content: What an experience! I organised a birthday dinner for 10 people plus a small child and everything, from the planning stage to the actual dining experience can only be defined as exquisite! The restaurant is in a beautifully restored building; we were given a private dining room for our party. The service staff was both highly professional and kind and catered perfectly to various dietary needs.   The dishes were all, without exception, delicious and beautifully presented. The vegan menu is as carefully and lovingly crafted as the "regular" menu, and I highly recommend it. All ingredients are locally and sustainably sourced. We chose local wines and were not disappointed.   As a Michelin star restaurant, Linhart is the right place to celebrate special occasions. I would like to extend a special word of thanks to Marcela, who helped me in the planning stage and welcomed us with her warmth, and to Chef Uro≈°, whose delicious creations will never be forgotten.   Thank you, we will definitely be back!

Author: Tja≈°a
Content: We came to the restaurant with a 1hour reserve, only to be welcomed like royalty... the staff was immaculate, the chefs brouht out our dishes and descibed them like a fairytale and the wine was sublime.... the ambiance was great, the clenlyness exellent but the food... oh the food was out of this worldüòç 12/10. Amazing

Author: Miha P
Content: Place is the best in Radovljica. Visitor will find nice atmosphere, connection with the other places in Radovljica, care for each detail, care for all visitors, poor or rich, known and unknown.  Reserve in advance, reserve your time, at least two hours. Order fresh, seasonal local food and taste it with smile on your face. You will not regret. This is not a place for big groups and gobblers. Natives and visitors from abroad are welcome. I didn't find better place in Gorenjska region, ≈†tajerska or Dolenjska.

Author: NearRTP
Content: Good atmosphere, good service, good food.  And a chocolate bomb for dessert!  Beautifully and expertly done and areal surprise at the end of the meal.

Author: Patjee123
Content: Lovely food, nice ambiance and the terrace is a great place to wind down and watch the tourists making their way through this tiny but lovely town.

Author: genevieve p
Content: We were surprised when we saw our plates arrive. Ridiculous Portions and High Awards.  Austere service.  Disappointment.

Author: Julio S
Content: It is a restaurant located at the entrance of the hotel of the same name, on very uncomfortable tables and in low light. They try to bring you the wine directly without offering you the menu, which has happened to me in several places in Slovenia. The wine list is correct, but not broad. We took the menu of 7 courses, of which only a couple of them stood out, the rest, nothing special. Normal desserts The price is very very expensive for what their dishes offer. The,staff is attentive and explains the dishes very well.

Author: Znene
Content: Small lovingly renovated hotel. The boss very friendly and helpful. The chef (chef) conjured up a perfect 9-course menu with preferably regional ingredients.  The morning after, freshly prepared egg compositions in the sunny garden.

Author: dpbi1992
Content: A hotel in the historic center inside a typical house. A beautiful spacious room with two bathrooms available. A very welcoming breakfast room. We were unable to taste the gastronomic offer of this renowned and starred hotel as it was closed, a real shame. Great quality breakfast. A highly recommended place. Thank you ....

Author: marione59
Content: If you want to spend a different New Year's Eve or simply a special evening away from the usual routes, if you want to lose yourself in an authentic dimension that smacks of times gone by, if you want to rediscover forgotten emotions or if you simply want to eat well, you are in the right place. H√Æsa Linhart can offer you all this and more. Rightly awarded the Michelin star (one of nine in the whole of Slovenia to have received the precious recognition) but also the green star of sustainability, it is the restaurant of the inn of the same name housed in an ancient building in the town of Radovljica, a stone's throw from the celebrated lake Bled. Landscapes with the unmistakable connotation typical of Alpine valleys, where woods and pastures are surrounded by mountains often covered in snow. We are just over 600 meters above sea level but thanks to the scent and clarity of the air it seems like we are decidedly higher. H√Æsa Linhart's cuisine rightly finds its products precisely in these areas and from organic and highly sustainable farms and crops and find their sublimation here. The menus offered include 5, 7 or 9 courses. It's true...it's New Year's Eve but the choice of seven courses will prove to be the right choice, the right compromise between hunger and gluttony. Mountain cuisine, certain cuisine, is particularly captivating also because it uses materials that can only be found in these places, materials that have the scent and flavor of natural, healthy, intact things. And the dishes, all the dishes on our menu will not betray this promise. The service is enhanced by the affability and professionalism of the kind owner of the restaurant who always presented the dishes to us in perfect Italian with precision and friendliness. A stop that allowed us to spend New Year's Eve in a new and unexpected way, in a different and original dimension, in tranquility savoring the proposals of excellent cuisine, far from the balls with unthinkable menus and crazy prices Thank you H√Æsa Linhart, we really had a great time! Too bad the rain then ruined the street party...

Author: Ren√© M
Content: The food is absolutely top class and definitely worth the price. Local delicacies are served by very well-trained staff. We will definitely come back.

Author: Jenny R
Content: Discovered thanks to the Michelin Guide, this starred restaurant offers lunches, dinners and also brunches. We had a great time!
